Great laptop… i dont know whether it is good for gaming… but the performance is fantastic. No lag at all

I bought this a few days ago, and I am glad I decided to make this purchase. This laptop is probably the only laptop in its segment that boasts such a spec heavy configuration without breaking the bank. The HP pavilion is such a compelling buy and boy does it deliver a premium experience throughout.
Having used a Pavilion 15 before, I gravitated towards the Pavilion series predominantly because of the typing experience and the speakers tuned by Bang and Olufsen! They sound mighty impressive for the price! It’s the same experience this time around. The audio is loud and crisp, and typing experience with 2 stage backlit chiclet keys is fantastic! They key travel and feedback is great. This probably is nitpicking, but the only gripe I have is the Power key is placed next to the Delete key. Although, accidentally pressing the power key won't turn off the device or put it to sleep. The 250 Nits IPS panel is crisp and bright for day to day indoor use. The viewing angles are great too with HDR playback support. Although, I would have loved atleast 300 nits plus panel given the price of the device. The chassis seems rigid and built to last! The top cover and the keyboard deck is metal, stays cool to touch as compared to the bottom cover which is plastic. The trackpad is quite large and supports windows gestures. The fingerprint reader is fast and accurate. The laptop remained silent during my entire sessions of document editing and reviewing. However, the fan kicked in during a windows update, and it was loud. The 43Wh cell helps this laptop with a good battery life. The 65-watt barrel pin charger helps in charging the device quickly, and the device can also be charged via PD enabled chargers via the Type-C port. One nifty addition is the HP Quickdrop. It lets users to transfer files back and forth with a companion mobile app. It’s a great addition for me as I can edit photos on Lightroom and quickly share them to my phone to be shared on social media! The i5 11 gen is a beast of a processor and it barely breaks a sweat during photo editing sessions. It can do some light title gaming with the Intel Iris Xe graphics.

Some closing thoughts:
The HP Pavilion with 16Gb RAM and 11th Gen Intel Core i5-1135G7 can be ideal machine for folks wanting a portable yet powerful machine without a hefty sticker price. It is like using a trimmed down version of HP ENVY without compromising on processing power. It has been a fantastic purchase so far!

Did a lot of research and landed on this laptop. I am not a gamer and didn't want a gaming laptop or a laptop with a dedicated graphics card. If that's your thing, then probably look elsewhere. Was not able to find this configuration anywhere for this price - 512gb SSD, 16gb RAM with i5 processor. It's an absolute beast. Everything flies and windows is looking so much better now (I was coming from a macbook pro). I was taken a back at how good this thing is. Does all the daily tasks without a sweat. The audio output is also decent (not great). Has a USB C port which can be used for charging (haven't tried this, but someone else had put a detailed review with this feature - check it out).

One con: If you close the lid and connect it to an external monitor, the wifi speed drops, if you're a bit far from your router. Let me explain: my office room is a bit far away from the router (don't ask me why I set it up like this). I took the laptop there and connected it to my monitor and closed the lid and kept it on a stand. The wifi became very slow. I disconnected the monitor and opened the lid and checked to see that the wifi speed was triple now. Googled and saw that the wifi antennas are below the trackpad - so someone suggested to keep the trackpad part of the laptop on top while placing it on the stand. This helped a bit; in the end, I kept the lid a wee bit open on the stand, and this solved the issue.

Review_title: One Of the Ideal Laptop for professional or student use.
Review_text:
I have been using this laptop since August, it's very compact and lightweight. The weight distribution is good but you still cannot open the lid with one hand.

The screen is okay not the best I have seen but you can perform day to day task very easily.

Keyboard is quite good, the key travel is nice and the three-level backlight is awesome.

The battery is same as any slim professional laptop, gives 4-5 hrs battery backup in normal use and definitely this number reduces when heavy tasks are performed.

Fingerprint accuracy 8.5/10.

Upgradability is the single ssd that you can swap for more storage and from two- 8gb ram one them is upgradable.

Conclusion, this laptop is a very good performer in the basic to semi-heavy tasks. Due to lack of dedicated graphics card, games are not as smooth they should be but as a professional this device in one of the best.
Sleek design, light weight, easy to carry. Just love it!
Nice power pack laptop in good price, I have used lightroom and photoshop software at the same time and no lag or no hang issues with this laptop.

Review post 1 week of laptop receipt + usage - Compact and very light to carry in ur bag pack without getting back ache, good typing experience along with backlit,  processor is just right for optimum office use, extended 2 yr warranty provided by HP makes u stress free (my another lenevo laptop died just 1 week post 1 yr std warranty i didn't buy extended warranty),  it has normal and sufficient ports that u need, good web cam, internal mic and beautiful speakers, head phone jack works well (took call using iphone 3.5mm wired headphone and worked perfectly fine for office meet). only issue is when click on date in system tray, it takes a while to load but that's bearable issue and not connected to HP hence fine.

It has all the specifications as advertised, i.e. 16 GB ram, and 500 GB NVME SSD. It does not have IR camera so no face unlocking will support. The finger print sensor is fast. Office 2019 is pre-installed and needs only to be activated, so while booting up for the first time it's best to have a mail id ready. the USB type C port is good and I have tested with data transfer only, not display and power output, although according to blogs and forums it will support both. Battery life is not completely tested but it's fairly ok, as of now I have got backup worth of definitely 6 hrs.
For office

Go for this laptop eyes closed, with this price 16 Gb ram is the best laptop to go for with the premium look and design. Use the laptop stand to maximize the productivity and durable life.

Cons - the screen cannot be rotated 180 degrees so can be problem with using at office with Laptop stand.

Performance is very good

Review_text: This laptop purchased for my son and my son is enjoying . Even I used this , The cost is worth as per the configurations .

Review_title: At this budget, it’s surely a go-to-device! Powerful!
Review_text:
Received this yesterday (04/03/2021). Prompt delivery by Amazon (as expected).

Clarifications/issue points:

1. It’s a plastic body and not aluminium.
2. Hinges do not lift the lower part of the laptop.
3. Fan noise is there and it tends to get a bit hot.
4. There’s no special point on the edge of the lid to easily open it. You need to struggle a bit.
5. Battery life is descent with normal everyday usage (apprx- 5-6 hours)
6. Quality of adapter is not that good and the pin connector is not that good in terms of quality. You have to be cautious.
7. Body is prone to scratches and if you buy silver colour, then they will be visible easily. So be cautious in that area as well.
8. The packaging quality seemed to be very low. It was all dusty. I had to clean a lot. Laptop also got some dust on it’s body although it was packed well inside a plastic sheet.

Pros:

1. Configuration is best at this price level.
2. Performance is excellent in terms of multi-media usage and online tasks.
3. Data transfer from various storage devices is a very fast.
4. It’s light weight as it’s a plastic build. But the plastic quality seems to be really sturdy.
5. Sound quality is also good but not very good or excellent as boasted in the ads or online reviews.
6. Display is average and gets the job done.
7. Typing on the keyboard is really good and large keys give you a sense of good confidence.
8. You get 476 GB of available SSD memory which I suppose is good enough. Good point- it’s expandable upto 1 TB.
9. Microsoft integration is seamless and quick.

Overall, at this price budget (INR-62990), it’s a really well thought product by HP.

I’ll update this review after one month of usage.
Everything is good. But I am little bit disappointed , I was expecting better battery backup.

Review_title: High Performance packed in a sleek & thin body
Review_text:
As soon as I found 11gen Gen i5 at ~62K I got stuck at it & after reading some initial reviews placed an order. Got it at promised time. Here's my review after 3 days.

Build & Looks are awesome. Very thin & sleek. Silver color adds to the classy looks. HP logo shining at the back further enhances it appearance. 1.4 Kg is not too light & noticeable. People complaining about placement of Power Key button beside delete button but believe me it'll hardly ever come your way. The plastic feels like metal. The screen doesn't lift keyboard. Typing is a pleasure.

Performance is just awesome. Boots in seconds (5 - 6 sec) & same way it shuts down. Finger print unlock is superfast. Apps opens in no time. Gestures works perfectly. All thanks to 11th Gen i5, 16GB Ram & 512 NvMe SSD.

Features: Comes with "Office Home & Student 2019" (didn't checked is it lifelong). Dropbox 25GB for 1 year also available. Comes with some HP apps & Express VPN as well. HP quick drop helps you transfer files from your phone easily. It has Type C charging point but not sure if it is delivery charging or receiving charging point. Keyboard is backlit with two setting (full & med bright).

Display: Didn't checked in daylight but at home it is very bright. Watching videos in FHD IPS display is a pleasure.

Camera is 720p Camera is OK. Pictures & Videos are grainy. I won't be using it much so I'm fine with that.

Speakers is unbelievably very loud & clear. At 67 its was reaching all across my apartment. Speakers are on the two sides below keyboard.

Only drawback I noticed was charging pin is too tight to push & pull out.

I will be posting more updates on performance, battery etc & also my overall experience as I keep using more & more.

Update after 2 weeks:
After lot of research & by doing practical I found that this Laptop can be charged by a Type-C charger. Believe me this is an exclusive piece of information, not many people knows this. HP call center didn't knew this, HP Showroom people don't know this, even when I asked question here someone provided wrong answer. This is an important information they should have mentioned in product detail that this Laptop supports Type C charging. I'm using HP original 65 W Type C power adapter to charge it. Attaching a photo. I did some research myself & found its USB Type C port has Power Delivery (PD) which is bi-directional, so a device can either send or receive power. After reading this I ordered the Type C power adapter & it worked.

Review_title: A good laptop from HP-Value worth
Review_text:
The laptop on an offer on Amazon is a good buy . All throughout hv used Fujitsu only in the corporate and personal world . The HP Pavilion comes as a surprise .

Positives
Light to carry , great screen display , perfect picture and a good bundling

Negatives
Only two UAB ports so you need a USB Bus , keyboard with backlit is at times blinding , keys are a bit flimsy and there is no accessory like a carry bag, mouse, mouse pad etc . Looks delicate overall as compared to much earlier versions

Overall a decent buy if you use an external keyboard and have a USB Hub .

Review_title: Indeed the best laptop for Business and Personal Use. Still a decent one for Gaming too.
Review_text:
I was almost checking several laptops in the price range of 55K - 70K INR and finally took this HP Pavilion 2021 for a great deal. I was initially reluctant in buying this over Lenovo Legion or Ideapad later understood I have done the right thing.

Coming back to the specs and overall review, just one word this laptop is AMAZING and worth buying. The bootup time is just 3 seconds. Intel Core i7 (11 Gen) is mind-boggling and SSD is an added advantage. The camera quality is convincing and the charging speed is okay. MS office students pack is a worthier inclusion and WIN 11 auto-update is top-notch.

The only con I felt in this device is a minute and very milder earth shocks observed in the other bezels (owing to the metal bezels) which is bearable.

The laptop is compact and light. Good bright screen resolution. Perfect size for my requirements for home usage and for my singing. While copying files from my hard drive, the computer kept hanging off and on and gave me trouble . Have been trying to delete old files after transferring to the new computer. Also difficult to get used to the absence of a right click option without a mouse. Overall hence a 4 rating.

Compared with other hp laptops model but white is not rich it's a mix of yellow. Hp support team doesn't provide a proper help. You have to bare with this scree.

Review_title: A good product for this price range
Review_text:
Performance is really good, However it is not future proof. Comes packed with a pin charger that’s not manufactured by Redmi and has no branding either!

Laptop on the other hand though is lightning fast and comes pre loaded with Latest Version of Windows 11! Iris XE does a tremendous job too! Highly recommended for daily usage!

Got this with exchange offer from Amazon.
I am a non-gaming, heavy user.
I have 10 stock market charts running, trading terminals, multiple browsers with atleast 50 tabs running daily continuously from 9 am to 11pm.
I am perfectly fine with the performance.
Boot up is real quick and there is no lag anywhere in performance.
Sound is decent.
Display is good. Im not able to figure out only one thing - the F6 toggle usually is used for cutting off display, but here it goes to monitor extension & there seems to be no screen off switch. To work around it I have the screen off thro windows after 2 mins.
Battery-I charge between 25% to 80% using a Battery Notification app. It takes 47 mins to charge and lasts for anything between 3hrs45mins to 4hrs30mins depending on usage. So we can say battery lasts approximately 4hrs on 60% charge.
Size and weight - thin and light.
Im happy with this laptop and feel its a good laptop to consider compared to costlier options at this price range of similar specs from other brands.
This review is done after 1 month of continuous work related usage.
A little bit heating problem while heavy gaming, apart this everything's good

3)Lacks voice assistant, but honestly it’s not a deal breaker
4)Soldered Ram

Verdict: Overall Good device with certain cons. Folks looking to buy this for entertainment might be discouraged by the speaker, but the screen is gorgeous. I mainly bought this for work and it perfectly serves my purpose. I would have given it 3.5/5, However, I bought this early and got the Galaxy buds 2 for 999. I would say this makes up for the terrible speakers :P

Hence my final rating is 4/5

P.S MS Office was not activated. However, Samsung service personnel and Microsoft technicians helped me out with this and solved the problem. As promised, this does come with Ms Office.

P.P.S First, fully update your Laptop. Then, contact Microsoft support and share with them the receipt. In my case, first, they uninstalled MS Office 365, then they installed MS Office home & student 2021. Then they did some of their magic and it was activated. All this happened via screen share and it took around 1.5 hours.
All the things are OK with the Samsung laptop, except battery backup. Need to work on providing long lasting battery at least 10-12 hrs.
Just 2 things are not satisfactory,  1) speak is low 2) MS Office Trial version.  Rest looks great , Design , sleek , screen,  Charger.... are good.

Pros-
Lightweight
Beautiful
Bright display
Fast bootup speed
Slim body

Cons-
Speaker volume very low
MS office not Activated
Not EVO platform
Windows hello not working

Review_title: Good budget laptop for students and basic professionals
Review_text:
This laptop is good for people who have a tight budget and seek performance and light weight laptop.

Pros
1. Light weight - 1.55 kg
2. Premium aluminum case finish
3. Crisp screen. Large aspect ratio.
4. Dolby atmos sound setup for earphones and sound systems
5. Backlit keyboard
6. Expandable SSD
7. Lots of ports (2 usb3, hdmi, c type, micro SD
8. Good sync with Samsung products (phones, buds, etc)
9. Fast processor i7 - latest12th gen, 16gb ram and 8 gb intel iris graphics
10. Super responsive finger print response for quick hassle free start
11. Shortcut (F11) to toggle between performance modes- optimised, high performance, silent, quiet.
12. For a laptop of this spec, showroom prices for diff brands are minm 90-100k. I got this for 72k which is quite a winning deal. (mrp 96k minus samsung launch discount 16k minus 4k credit card discount minus 4k samsung ref discount)

Cons-
1. The worst thing about this laptop is the dolby speakers. Its of no use. If u heavily need laptop speakers then this is not for u. I use earphones most of the time hence i can ignore this. But so far, this is the worst laptop speaker ever.
2. They claim of HD 720p camera. I found it quite mediocre. I expected it to be crisp but its very noisy camera.
3. Touchpad looks and functions well but the clicks are not smooth or silent . You need to press it and hear the click which i found really pathetic.
4. The battery back up is 5 hrs max for light use like attending video lectures, study purpose etc. For heavy application is might be 3 hrs. Dont go by Samsung's claim for 8 hrs. I never got it .. even in the beginning.

Overall this laptop works good for my use of studying, video editing (adobe premier pro) and little gaming . For those who can ignore the cons this laptop is the best available in segment. I rate it 4 stars (1 reduced for speakers and battery life)

Review_title: Bought 20K worth of company promotion, not a smartphone!
Review_text:
I just made a huge mistake today(25th June 2022) buying this phone after looking at spec sheet and Youtube reviews alone. Looks like the company has deceived many people including consumers and reviewers by sending a wrong expectations.

Yes, I knew the camera was not going to be excellent as it should for a mobile positioned at 20K INR. But look at the first picture, 12Megapixel of rear camera after advertising 50MP AI Camera? BTW, front camera shows the resolution as 16MP

The front camera feels bit ok than the rear. It is so weird!

And from the start, till setting up the phone, it is full of bloatwares and unauthorized advertisements popping up in apps' interface like Phone Master, all over UI, sucking up 64% of 8GB RAM for no reason at idle!

Look at the pictures I have shared for RAM and the number of apps currently installed.

The phone otherwise feels snappier for just swiping through screens but I haven't done any heavy usage like gaming to say.

I can't even imagine having such a poor software optimization, a company dares to market a phone at 20K INR!

So cheap attitude!

the phone was delivered on time. It heats quickly when playing the game even with low graphics and video quality with amazon prime and the Hotstar was really pathetic. I feel cheated. Please don't mislead the people. It is really 6nm chip has been put inside it. I doubt that. When I refund, they are saying to visit the technician after two days. They should tell the customer before buying that they cannot make the refund directly. now I have to wait for two days for the technician in which there is no my fault. This is not a transparent deal with amazon. They just give 7 days for the refund. when they could not give one minute extra from the time of refund policy, why are they taking two days in that period?  But anyway, thank you for wasting my money.

Alright here’s the thing! Looking to buy a phone for it’s camera? Look elsewhere. Don’t even bother buying this one.

For anything else, this phone’s a BEAST!

A 3 week review:
It can rival any flagship on performance. Gaming is a dream! Most played games- New State on Max Ultra as highest graphics, Asphalt 9, Modern Combat 5, Crash Bandicoot, Iron Blade, NFS Most Wanted. Games are super smooth and it’s a killer performer! If you wanna get this phone for gaming performance, the CPU GPU are sick. Mind it mild heating is experienced when playing New State on highest graphics, but nothing even close to being warm. 120 Hz refresh rate works fine. Haptics are satisfactory.

Day to day performance is a breeze. It crushes the S20 FE. Obviously due to a newer SOC. No stutters no lags, not a single app crash in 3 weeks is commendable. It runs on Android 11 and no update yet. Though it’s running on security update released in September. I don’t have hopes on that front. It runs on a heavily skinned version of android, which I personally don’t like at all, but its stock launcher is just fine. Though I don’t use it.

Screen is LCD, and outdoor visibility is poor since it doesn’t go up too much on brightness in nits. But the colours are just fine. Very nice display for indoors. Games and videos look immersive. The screen is a mammoth size and gripping the phone isn’t a task as it isn’t too heavy without the case. It does come with a case in the box so that’s awesome! I’m not a Man City fan, so the embossing of the logo on the phone’s back as well as on case does feel a bit forced upon, but it’s easy to get over after a while, especially since you’re not staring at the back all the while. You tend to forget it’s there.

It has a single bottom firing speaker which is not too loud. That’s one thing I don’t like. There’s no reason not to include a stereo setup especially when the cheaper Pova 3 has it.

The body is all plastic, but doesn’t feel cheap. The rainbow effect on back is just beautiful. Overall the looks are gorgeous I feel. The camera modules too blend in beautifully. The back makes any other phone look outdated frankly. It’s so futuristic. Hold it to believe me!

It’s got a very bright flash on rear and a front facing flash too. That’s awesome. But cameras…meh! I won’t even talk about it.

The battery easily lasts more than 24 hours with moderate gaming, YouTube playing and few phone calls. It’s a humongous battery! Charge speed is just ok. I’d have liked it to include a faster charger, but at this price, you really can’t complain.

So basically guys, it’s a gaming beast. Just go ahead and buy it without much thought if gaming is your thing.

And oh the bloatware! It’s annoying. They put Samsung to shame with the amount of bloat they have loaded. But most things you can get rid off. Other things you can simple disable. Although that’s additional work after buying the phone.

Scores out of 10:-
Camera - 2
Screen - 7
Speed and performance - 10
Software - 5
Price and affordability - 20!

The box contains:
-The phone(with pre-applied screen guard)
-Charger
-Sim ejector tool
-Phone Case
-Warranty card and a manual

About the phone:
On the first day using the phone, it discharged very quickly. Also charging from 2 to 72 percent, it took around 3 hours. But these statistics were only for the first day.

From the second day onwards, the phone seemed to last as labelled on the app. It's been a full day and the phone only came down to 62 percent from 100 percent in the morning.

*Performance is excellent.
*Refresh rate lives up to the mark.
*Battery backup as stated is really good except for the first day.
*Camera is decent
*Although the phone comes with many pre-installed unwanted apps, majority of them can be removed without any hassle.
*Speaker is fine
*Voice quality is good while on phone
*The call recording feature alerts the other person about the call being recorded. I'd recommend to install third party call recorder.
*One of the best features I liked about the phone is Video Assistant. You can actually watch YouTube videos without keeping the screen on. It really helps when you use YouTube for listening to music. The video assistant can be accessed from the smart panel by dragging and holding your finger from either the right side or the left side.
*Have not tried playing games on It yet
*Fingerprint sensor is amazingly fast and accurate. Face unlock too.
*On an average, it takes around 1.5 hrs for full charge.

After 2 weeks of usage:

*Refresh rate sometimes drops below 120hz, you can feel it, and have to restart phone.
*Battery backup is amazing, around 1- 1.5 days of battery backup for normal usage.
*But charging is not upto the mark. It takes around 1.5 - 2 hrs to get full charge while the company states it takes 30 min for 50% charge which is unrealistic.
*Brightness is a little low as it is sometimes difficult to see in sunlight.
*Phone heats a little while playing games but that is common.

Great battery life. I used it for two days on a single charge. Very good clarity in the camera. But there are some problems in the phone like there are useless apps pre-installed and you can't even delete it!!! But still overall it's an 8.5 out of 10 for me.

Review_title: Value for Money smartphone but with a catch.
Review_text:
If you could get this phone for 16k or lower then it is actually a value for money phone with decent processor and specifications.
Sure the phone would have been better if it had a better camera and an amoled screen but you cannot get everything for 16k I guess. They have to do cost cutting somewhere.

Pros :
1. Snappy for day to day usage and moderate gaming.
2. Excellent Battery life (8hrs Screen on time for heavy usage and 12hrs for low to moderate usage). Could last a day and a half in simple words.
3. Big display so a good media consumption experience. (AMOLED would have been better though).

Cons :
1. Speaker. Not loud and not so good quality.
2. User Interface, though has many things to offer, it is full of bloatwares and not so much optimized.
3. Camera is good for QR code scanning and average photos in daylight but forget about good pictures at night.

Last thing. Since all the mobiles generally come with google dialer now, this phone also has default google dialer and now the other person will get notified when you start recoring the call. :-)

Conclusion: If you are looking for a phone that could last for 2-3 years doing basic smartphone things like media consumption, moderate gaming and using social media and do not want to spend more than 15-17k on a smartphone then this might be the phone for you but you might need to compromise a little on clean UI and a good quality camera phone.

Lastly, the company is relatively not so famous and trusted like other big brands so after sale services and quality assurance are still the things to be tested for me as well.

Till then it is doing pretty good job for my use case scenario.

Review_title: Great phone at this price point.
Review_text: Overall no complaints after nearly a month of usage. The screen gets scratched as I guess, this doesn't come with Gorilla glass protection. A screen guard is recommended (but not easy to get it for this model). Though it says it's 120hz refresh rate, scrolling is not as smooth as a your premium phones with the same refresh rate. Battery is awesome. Slight heating is noticed while charging but nothing to be too cobcerend about. Decent fingerprint scanner. No complaints wrt to Ram. Excessive bloatware(which can be uninstalled). Camera is ok although the photos look a little too perfect and clean. It sucks that Tecno has not confirmed an Android 12 update while it's contemporary Infinix zero has. I hope they do release it for this model. Although some people have complaind about the app lock, it seems to work fine. There is a secure Vault feature too. There are a bunch of free themes and wallpapers offered, which is great. THERE IS A MISCONCEPTION THAT THIS IS AN INDIAN PHONE BUT PLS NOTE THAT IT'S AN OUT AND OUT CHINESE BRAND..THE SAME COMPANY WHICH OWNS INFINIX BRAND. Claim is that its manufactured in India but its a Chinese owned brand. Overall it's a really decent buy at this price point.

Have been using this phone since one month..
Not much special in terms of performance, quality and average kinda phone

I brought for my parents. This is really a value for money phone. Nice Display, Awesome Camera, Fast processor, long Battery backup.. Great 👍🏻

Review_title: Nice Phone. Ultra fast response. Right Price
Review_text: If you are not concerned about the brand image, here’s a nice mobile phone for you. I liked its fast response to open and run the apps. Camera is quite okay at 1x, but the quality drops drastically while zooming. Could not see the option for time stamping on pictures. Display quality is nice at increased brightness. Good battery life. Big Display makes it easy to read and cool to watch movies.

I am using this phone from 2 days, battery is realy impresive, processor and RAM Management is awesome.
Camera is decent, I missed wide angle camera and micro camera.
Front selfie is good.
In 20 k this phone is good performance phone. If you want camera centeric phone the move to other option, but want a performance centric phone then this one is good choice.
One another phone is launched as same price and feature named is Infinix zero.
But I am sure, that phone is not compare to this because of battery backup.
So I am going to give 4 star for this performance centric phone. I cut 1 star because this phone have not a wide angle camera.

Review_title: Cheap but clearly at the expense of performance
Review_text:
You can keep this as a phone you might want to use as a backup in case your phone breaks down all of a sudden. It might serve a purpose better than having no phone at all. To me, it seems like Redmi is openly saying that for a phone with a price of <7k, a terribly unresponsive interface and graphics lag is what you can overlook, given that the ROM is 32gb while RAM stays still at the 2gb mark. Up to a certain extent, I could agree to this argument, but Redmi 6A, which is a model way older and was sold back in 2018-19 is a much better smartphone in terms of responsiveness. We are not buying a new phone - be it a cheap one - just to find that the call logs screen takes about 2 to 2.5 secs to transit from an older call log screen. And if in between this, you happen to press any of the dialled nos, it would make a call to the unintended contact before you realize that it was an older screen. This becomes frustrating after a while.

This phone has an outstanding battery backup with normal usage. That said, I think it is one buyable smartphone among those close to this price point.

Review_title: Good Budget Phone for Basic Usage
Review_text:
For a 2Gb RAM 32Gb internal storage this phone works miraculously. Good for basic social media usage like YouTube, Facebook and Instagram but would not suggest for gaming purpose. Though overlapping of videos seems to be an issue but overall in 480p the videos run smoothly on any platform. Good budget phone for basic usage only.

Battery Life : Low for strenuous usage
Camera Quality : Takes good shots

Review_title: There are Major Issue in this model
Review_text:
1. Major SIM Network Issue is there. hone will show the full network but it is disconnected from the network. The best part is you will never know that your phone is out of network. Nobody will be able to call you. You have to restart the phone again and again or enable/disable flight mode again and again.

2. The Same issue is with the Wi-Fi network as well. Also, the range of WiFi connectivity is very less compared to previous phones like Redmi Note4 and other models.

3. Youtube and other apps are also frequently disconnected from the network. They stop working.

4. Also MIUI 13 is not properly working on this phone.

5. There are a lot of bugs in this phone. This is not a stable version of Redmi.

I dont know why redmi nowadays degrading the quality. I really miss an era when I loved to use redmi phones. Camera quality is totally waste. While on video call, other person can't see me camera captures black video. Not sure how to resolve this but I had purchased redmi note 11 and it had similar issue.
So I returned both this one and Redmi note 11 also.
I will never purchase any redmi phones now.
Redmi ab pahle jaisa nahi raha 🥺

Review_title: My Redmi Note 5 pro is better than Note 11T
Review_text:
1-Redmi Note 5 Pro having battery 4000 mamp and this Note 11T having 5000 mamp still this is draining fast. I am using half apps compare to note 5 pro.
2-My note 5 pro never got hanged in dual WhatsApp and inspite of 6GB RAM in this phone WhatsApp getting hanged. I am not able to attached photos, contacts a blank appearing in that space ?
3-Earphone also having very low sound inspite raising it to full
4-THIS CALL IS GETTING RECORDED audio getting while recording calls. Unable to disable this found which very BAD.
5-Phone contacts edit option is NOT AVAILABLE AT ALL in phone.
I and my family now having total 10+ redmi phones but due to this redmi note 11T performance I am not sure, I may think for buying redmi again...
I am not returning this as my need of phone is more important than its performance.
Secondly I had also send feedback from time to time but not received any revert over mail or on phone from redmi...

So this is my feedback.... and choice is yours.

Review_title: wi-fi gets disabled if phone is not used for more than 3-4 hours
Review_text:
wi-fi gets disabled if phone is not used for more than 3-4 hours. this is how i identified.
after you wakeup in the morning, check the wi-fi status at the top, it would not be present, now as you have switched on the screen, wi-fi gets connected. showed this issue to the service center, even they dont have solution.

check the attached video.
observe wifi symbol at the top, its not present, as you screen is ON, wifi connects and symbol appears.

unfortunately i ordered two units(mobiles), in both the units this problem exists

Review_title: Pathetic product delivery experience from Amazon
Review_text:
The phone that was delivered had many problems such as 1. shutting down abruptly in between, 2. The camera not working & 3. Screen touch response is poor look like a damaged piece that was rerouted to another customer (me in this case) post returned from someone else.

Raised complaints and after submitting multiple technicians visit the same technician is getting assigned every time who is denying the visit the place and canceling the technical visit request from his end citing different reasons.

Now, I am stuck between amazon and their technical support team. Amazon not allowing me to return the product without a technical visit and the technician not accepting the request even after multiple attempts.

Dear readers, I bought this cell in great Indian Festival of Amazon, trust me this is nothing less then a nightmare, product is nowhere near its description, go for other product Camera quality is worst both front and back, finger touch sensor doest not works at all, SELLER HAS GIVEN ME USED ITEM WHICH NO ONE (AMAZON NITHER MERCHANT ) IS READY TO TAKE BACK, SEAL OF CELL BOX WAS OPEN, Think twice thrice before buying from amazon

This phone was delivered to me on 26-9-22 and it stopped working after  one day itself.... I advise all Amazon shoppers not to buy phones from Amazon ever.... And I am a heavy purchaser from Amazon but Amazon is not a good place to buy phones....

Review_title: Really A bad/waste product. Don't purchase this product.
Review_text:
Product is OK , Not Good or Super.
Positive Points-
1. Processor is Super
2. Fast Charging works super
3. Good Battery Backup
Negative Points-
1. Display quality below the expectation, Galaxy A51 Display is far batter then this one.
2. Unable to play 2160p Video ,Galaxy A51 play 2160 Videos easily.
3.Pocket Mode is not available, though in Old MI, Redmi smart phones Pocket mode is available.
4.Unable to get/found Group Ringtone Selection, which is really very easy in Galaxy A51.
5.Now maximum no of smart phones have 3 or more rare camera setup, but in this device only 2 camera setup is available. what a feature....
6. Even Galaxy A51 have 32MP selfie camera setup, but in Redmi Note 11T 5G have 16MP selfie camera.
7. Maximum number of 5G smartphones are receiving Android 12 Update in March/April. But till now I didn't get any official info regarding Android 12 update for Redmi Note11T 5G.
8. Proximity sensor is not working .No proximity sensor option is available in handset.. It's really disgusting....
9. When I trying to use VoWIFI service no incoming calls are not-working ,Outgoing calls are also not working .

Yesterday I just received the Redmi Note 11T 5G smartphone. Before I'm using Galaxy A51 (8GB/128GB).now I'm thinking about Go back to Galaxy A51 again , is that way at least I can enjoy Android 12 experience after few days. Allover Redmi Note 11T 5G is not superb, not up to the mark.

Delivery is super, Amazon Delivery partner/person's behave is excellent,28th March 9pm I placed order & 29th March around 11am I received Package. Thanks Amazon.

The phone n the charger both heats up like anything. While updating apps, the phone hangs up. It is non returnable product n the Amazon has made a long stringent policy for replacing or return, post number of tech visits which leaves a customer completely harassed. Just don't waste your money on this product.

I bought this after lot of research and this is my review after using it on first day
1) decent camera liked the clarity and colours
2) amazing speed and nice performance with two options of 60hz or 90 hz refresh rate which can be chosen , ofc i liked the 90hz as its fluid.
3) 6gb ram + 2gb booster
4) battery is really quick to charge with 33w charger , but initially battery drains quickly but it will optimize after some time
5) need to uninstall bloatwares
6) light weight with punchhole display
7) fingerprint nice and accurate
8) i liked the typing experience , it was really fluid
9) front camera had bit noise in video recording especially but still its decent
10) nice experience with stereo speakers , bottom one is louder than top one.
I recommend it, lets see how it performs in upcoming days

Review_title: The process to purchase against exchange is troublesome and didn't work out.
Review_text: The policy of exchange of old phone, while purchasing a new one is not correct. The delivery person is asking for the old phone to be given to him while he is delivering the new one. The old phone contains all data and application which needs to be transferred to the new phone. And for that at least one day time is required. In my case, I was forced to make full payment as I failed to handover the old phone to the delivery agent. This is a wrong policy, in my opinion, and should be looked into carefully. Flipkart offers pickup of the old phone as per customer's convenience, which is good policy, and provides the value of the old phone after picking up and checking the condition of the phone. My request to amazon is to look into it carefully and change the policy accordingly.

Review_title: Value for money, under budget, category leader.
Review_text:
I was a bit confused while buying but compared some other phones within the same range and found RealMe Narzo 50i to be the most competitive and just purchased it.
It’s one month of using it and I don’t see any sort of deterioration in any aspect, be it battery life, sound, or any other.
Moving on to the features and their rating based on my experience-
Battery life- 4/5
Privacy Features- 3/5
Processor & No Lag capacity- 3/5
Camera- 3.5/5
Biometric scan time- 4/5
Sturdiness- 5/5
Storage & Ram- 3.5/5
Display Resolution- 4/5
Value for Money- 4.5/5
Overall consumer policy- 4/5
This particular mobile phone would be best for you (or someone you know) if you don't do any sort of professional work, but if you just need it for covering daily basic needs and don’t wanna spend much for any reason.
The only part that didn’t fit along was that in the 'in the box’ section of the item description, the seller has mentioned 'case' and 'USB type c cable' as the part of accessories provided with the handset.
However, no case was provided (and wasn’t mentioned on the original box too) and the cable which I received was USB type ‘b’
Whether this is the incompetence of the seller (in the verification of information) or a deliberate act, I believe Amazon is in a better position to analyze this.
All the other product delivery processes were extensively smooth and I got it delivered in under 48 hours of ordering as well.
All in, I would say that it’s a value for money option to be considered if you don’t wanna spend much but still prefer the best amongst the given options under the same price range.
But if you are someone who has a lot of professional or personal work then you might wanna consider some other options as well which have better overall performance on the expense of some of the features you might not need to work with.
So, here is my take and opinion on this particular mobile phone.
Feel free to reply if you need to ask something specific.

Review_title: Genuine review after 4 Months of use.
Review_text:
Reviewing after 4 Months of using the device.
If we talk about specifications, it's no doubt there is no smartphone available in the market in this price with this much high specs BUT it's of no use.

Even after having this much high specs on paper, the experience of using the phone doesn't make us feel that we are using that much high spec powered phone and the price is too high for the overall user experience. Reasons are coming down.

Starting with the good part and going further with the unpleasant experience of being a user of iQOO 7 legend.

Looks (9/10)
No one can deny the phone is having an eye catchy look and the company provides cover with the BMW Logo makes is more cool. The BMW M Sport inspired stripes on the back makes it look more premium.

Charging (9/10)
The phone is having 67 W fast charging which is actually superfast. The phone charges from 0 - 100% within 30 mins if on standby. If you charge it while using the same, the time takes to charge it fully is bit higher depending on the work you are doing.

Dual Speakers (7/10)
Company have provided the dual speakers but the sound is not that loud. It feels like a single speaker only.

Display (7/10)
Packed with AMOLED display with the 120Hz refresh rate. Looks good but not the best.

Camera (6/10)
Inspite of having 48 MP camera, the pictures quality is not so good. Not bad too but can be bettered.

Battery backup (6/10)
The phone is powered with 4000 mAh battery wich doesn't last till it should be. Battery drains too fast even on standby. A power bank is must for long travellings.

Gaming (6/10)
Despite of having SD888 processor, the high end gaming like PUBG/BGMI doesn't makes feel you that you are having a monster. Introducing the phone as a gaming phone is just a hype. The phone is having 120hz refresh rate still PUBG/BGMI still not supporting 90 fps. Game center is having a good options like picture in picture using WhatsApp. Voice changer (needs some improvement).

RAM Management (3/10)
I was using 12gb RAM variant of it. Having so called 3gb additional virtual RAM. Even having so much of RAM, the apps get refreshed if in background. Even if the screen is on and you are working on phone. Also there is no option of disabling the virtual RAM. This means you are having 3gb less internal storage and it is not actually adding any value to the experience of using the device.

Heating (3/10)
Heating of device while heavy usage like playing high graphics games or using some heavy application is understandable but this device even heats on standby while all the apps are closed and no background work is in process. So much dissappointing.

UI/OS (2/10)
The phone is having so called Stock Android based FuntouchOS. I have used Samsung, MI and OnePlus phones. The FuntouchOS is worst of all. So let's talk about why it's worst.
- If you are using 2 Sim cards and you wanna switch the data connection, there is no option of doing the same from notification shutter. This can be only done by going to the settings.
- If you like customization, this phone is for you only if you want to spend extra money even after spending 40k - 45k. Why extra money? You can't even change the icon of the phone without using different themes provided at the theme store. And yes for using the themes you need to buy them first. The price is not much but still after spending the hefty amount if you can't even change the icon by just using icon packs from the Play Store then it's irritating.
- It may shock you but it's true that the phone does not supports AR (Augmented Reality). May be this is not the deal breaker but but but, again if you are spending that much hefty amount of 40k - 45k and not getting the very basic feature wich is available in the lowest price phones then this is unexpected.
- Always on display only shows limited application notifications.

What can be bettered (this part is just for the understanding the capacity of device)
- Instead of FuntouchOS, if the company have worked on the global vision of the OriginOS (currently only available in devices launched in China) and would have launched the device with the OrginOS, the user experience must have been increased.
- Notification LED is missing but can be fixed. How? Whenever the front camera starts, LED light blinks around the camera. The same can be used as notification light.
- Data switch option in notification shutter can be given by just small update.
- Virtual RAM disabling option needs to be added.

My conclusion: the device look is really awesome and eyecatchy with the BMW branding but spending 40k - 45k just for the looks is not a good idea because other things of device does not worth the amount.

Review_title: IQOO 7 LEGEND 5G DONT WAST UR MONEY AND SPECIALY ON AMAZON THEY FOOLED YOU
Review_text:
IQoo7 legend.
Pros:
1. Solid & premium build
2. Latest SoC SD 888 waste for non gamers.
3. Great looks
4. Fast charging 0 to100% in just under 25 minutes.
5. Good rear camera in day light.
7. No heating issues on general use.

Cons:
1. Really heavy 206 gms, very difficult to handle in one hand.
2. Small battery for the weight, just 4000mah,
3. Very poor battery back up. Hardly lasts 8 to 10 hours with normal use.
4. Too much of bloatware, u can't uninstall or disable.
5. Funtouch 11is a poor UI
6. Absence of key features like file safe/private safe folder,
7. Highly complicated UI. Worst in the market.
8. In screen finger print scanner placed too low, n sluggish. Not user friendly.
9. Absence of 3.5mm jack
10. Poor quality back cover provided. Highly slippery.
After one weeks usage:
1. Worst phone. Never buy this crap.
All-new phone with SD888 hangs on day 7 and nothing u can operate barring volume button. Power button stuck to Emergency call n will not be able to re-start or power off.
Then no option but to force start.
2. Bad cameras in low light.
3. Due to weight very difficult to operate in one hand.
4. Very poor battery life.
5. I don't know what all information they collect. Every basic function asks for permission to gather personal information.
6. As a wellwisher my advice, please don't buy, if you have bought one return or replace it soon.
After 10days of usage:
1. Poor network connectivity
2. When you're on a call, an incoming call will light up d screen, n proximity sensor stops working, so either ur call is disconnected, or some unwanted action performed.
3. Very poor speaker volume n clarity
4. After few minutes into call, the call quality gradually drops, n need to struggle to hear.
5. Upper border of display has black tint needing aliasing SW n tweaking
6. proximity sensors doesn't work, screen keeps lighting.
7. If you are using connected to say Bluetooth in car, once you get out of the car, or BT interrupted, call doesn't get transferred to phone speakers, trust me phone hangs.
8. With ongoing call, you can't switch to an incoming call, phone hangs.
9. This crap is with full of bugs.
So, friends, one of the worst products. Think 100 times before buying!!!
DONT BELEVE ON AMAZON THEY ARE MAKING FOOL YOU WHEN YOU RETURN THE PRODUCT IN MY CASE I RETURN THE DEFECTIVE PEACE ADN THEY PROMISE ME WILL REFUND ALL AMOUNT I PAID AND EXCHANGE MONEY WHAT I GET ON MY POCO F 1 PHONE BUT ITS A APPROX 9 DAY THEY DID NOT PAY ME ALL WHAT THEY PROMISE .

Review_title: Looks nice, feels nice, is heavy, but can not recommend
Review_text:
This phone arrives in a good sturdy box.

Pros.
1. Looks nice. Feels nice. Is heavy. Glass back is smooth and I love it.
2. It's SD888, 120Hz so it is smooth.
3. Haptic feedback is good.
4. RAM is 8GB and is not expandable.
5. Charges really quick. I would say 22-25 mins for 0 to 90%.

Cons.
1. It has only a 4000mAh battery so it discharges quickly too.
2. It shows ads when you go to the gallery to see pics. To remove ads there is a monthly $2 subscription for the gallery.
3. In the gallery, you can not just open a pic full screen, go back to the album and open another pic full screen. There is a delay of 2 seconds to show ads every time you go back to the album after opening an image. So it would be really annoying to see many pictures you took one by one. Because you see ads in between them.
4. So many unnecessary, unrelated notifications from the v-store that keeps your display cluttered and mind busy while using it. There are times that make me forget while I picked up the phone in the first place while cleaning up the mess on the screen before I begin using it for my purpose.
5. Camera is above average at best. The timelapse is not as consistent as other Samsung devices. There would be breakage in the sequence while using the long exposure. It needs to be on Tripod only while using long exposure. No handheld long exposure would make sense to show off or share with others, no matter how steady it would be.

Review_title: Not at all value for money
Review_text: This phone is not at all value for money because after spending so much there is constant problem with all phone call's voice quality. There is no earphone jack if you can't even use collar mics with this phone. The speaker volume is very low so if you have to give online classes this phone is a wrong choice. The phone is heavy & using it for long calls is simply a nightmare. It can give you horrible neck pain & then you have to spend more money and time to get treatment. With Earplugs the voice keeps breaking & ppl on the other side can't hear you clearly and you have to shout constantly. Even a regular phone plays louder videos than this one. No one spends so much money for a just a fingerprint reader. The front camera is just about okay for this much money. If you make videos using front camera better to buy some other phone whose front camera is equal or close to the back camera (higher MP). The pictures come nice though. The only good thing is the smooth UI so u can edit videos and enjoy reading books and sending emails but watching movies with low speaker volume in not fun at all. The phone's low volume can spoil the overall experience. With all the basic problems like speaker, phone calls, poor battery one ends up feeling cheated. So don't buy it especially not the one that comes for 44K but if you buy the one cheaper than 44k then the Ram is only 8GB. So, I feel they should have priced it slightly lower and added some of things that are missing.

Review_title: A good phone with bad UI
Review_text:
Got the phone today (08/05), performance wise all good and I'm happy with it. I was using OnePlus 7t prior to this and if you are anyone coming from the oxygen OS it would be a bit hard to digest the new UI. Not the best and there a ton of bloatware some can be removed and some not. If you are a person who is not worried about UI please go ahead with the purchase. Cameras are good but the UI is again meh.

Running into a lot of issues with using apps like google dialer, the app says the phone is not supported.
Background processes does not die even if you clear them out. Make a call -->clear all apps-->check for background apps you will still see the phone app :(

I am using the phone with nova launcher to get a good UI but the phone keeps killing it for some reason unknow.

Updated to 2 stars.
This is a mess and the UI has a loooooad of bugs and I don't expect them to be fixed.

Retaining 2 stars
Phone does not allow third party lauchers to work smoothly. Nova launcher (prime) gets killed very often for no reason.
If you make a call or open any system settings it will stay in the memory evennif you had killed it from recent apps once.

Within 5 days of buying this mobile its charger stopped working so I returned it. There was also green tint issue present. IQOO is not trustworthy brand better go for Poco X3 Pro, it doesn't have bleeding edge specs but it is the best value for money smartphone available right now. Whether you use it for gaming or day to day daily tasks you will not feel any stutter. If you want SD 888, amoled display, UFS 3.1 storage, LPDDR5 ram and good camera setup wait for a few months for Realme GT to launch. It will be launched in India before Diwali and price will be around 30K. IQOO 3 was launched for a price of 44K for 12GB 256GB variant, but its price dropped to 22K this week. So you can get an idea how cheap it is to manufacture IQOO phones. These phones are not worth the money.

If you want SD 888, amoled display, UFS 3.1 storage, LPDDR5 ram and good camera setup wait for a few months for Realme GT to launch. It will be launched in India before Diwali and price will be around 30K. IQOO 3 was launched for a price of 44K for 12GB 256GB variant, but its price dropped to 22K this week. So you can get an idea how cheap it is to manufacture IQOO phones. These phones are not worth the money.

Review_title: People went unnecessarily crazy for this Legend Edition.
Review_text:
I've been using this phone (Legend Edition) for about 2 & a 1/2 months now, all I can say is it's a moderately overrated device. I'll list all the pros and cons I can think of.

PROS:
1) Looks great, eye-catching back cover. Amidst the crowd of blue, pink, cyan, black phones, this one definitely stands out. The back is smudge-proof, upto an extent. 5/5
2) Very fast charging. 5/5
3) Speakers good enough for me ( though it is considerably lower than my previous phone OnePlus 7). 4/5
4) In-display fingerprint scanner and face unlock works fine. 4.5/5

CONS:
1) Battery life is bad. Not extremely bad, but bad. I'm not a gamer or a very heavy user, but I struggle to make it last one whole day. But it charges very fast, so that's a plus point. 3.5/5
2) Camera is not that great. But the default Camera app has many features which may be useful to some. I don't know why people say that this has the best camera setup in this price segment, but in my opinion it's not that great. Selfie camera is bad. Also when you open the camera app from the lock screen, it is full of glitches, can't even get to see the shutter many a times. 3/5
3) The UI is not that great. You'll get many bloatware you can't uninstall. Gives false notifications also about battery being drained by certain apps which were not even running in the background. 3.5/5
4) Notifications are wrong (specially the SMS app). Certain apps don't even show notifications, no matter how hard you try. 1/5
5) Phone gets warm when you're charging it, but I guess that's normal when we're using turbo charger. 4/5
6) Very slippery side panels. Get a good bumper cover. They provided a silicon cover that was very slippery and turned yellow (looked like it got jaundice) after 7 days. Camera bump will cause scratches unless you're keeping it face-down. 4/5

My personal verdict: Overrated device. I'd suggest to not go aftwr watching a million unboxing videos, because I'm pretty sure by now that those were paid reviews. I don't want you to agree with me, but I am giving my honest review after buying it with my hard earned money and using it for more than 2 months.

Thank you.

Review_title: OVERALL GOOD PHONE BUT HAVE A GREEN TINT WHEATHER YOU INCREASE BRIGHTNESS OR DECREASE IT.
Review_text:
There is green tint issue. Because in my device iQoo7 legend 5G and this is my 2nd second replacement when I apply dark mode along with dark amoled wallpaper it seems to see greenish tint at the top of the notification panel as I increased the brightness the greenish tint increases this issue is only been seen on the home screen when dark wallpaper is applied along with dark mode. Will this get fix via OTA or whether it's an hardware issue.
Even increasing the brightness the tint also get increased but only been seen near the notification bar in home screen.
Is their any issue with this panel.
No issue are seen while watching movies or playing games and surfing the internet.

This issue is only been seen by applying dark amoled wallpaper and by turning on the dark mode and by going into the dark room.
Will this get fixed by an OTA update or it's and hardware issue. Because this is my second replacement for this issue.

Do every unit have similar issue because my first unit was also having the same issue even after the replacement issue still persist.

The areas where I have seen green tint issues are.
1) When I do a call and lock the phone and then on lockscreen by pulling down the notification bar green tint would be seen.
2) By enabling fingerprint in whatsapp the green tint could be seen while unlocking using fingerprint.
3) By applying dark amoled wallpaper and by enabling dark mode green tint could be seen near the notification panel in home screen.

Please iQoo India take this issue seriously. If you have understood what I am telling to say.

Kindly solve the issue because many of the user's faced similar issue otherwise the phone is awesome. Please try to fix it via an OTA update.

Review_title: I'm writing this review after 3 months of usage. Please read before buying.
Review_text:
1. Camera :
Pros - Excellent photo and video quality. Image stabilization mode in video is awesome.
Cons - Half washed away photos are created at once in a while. Image attached.

2. Battery :
Pros - Full charge in 30 mins.
Cons - Full charge not sufficient for one days usage. I am a regular YouTube watcher. I charge twice a day. Battery drains so speed.

3. Sound :
Pros - Nothing so far. Average Call speaker sound.
Cons - Media Volumes (YouTube) are very less. I tested the sound volume of same media with OnePlus. This one fails there. I ended up using ear phones.

4. User Interface:
Cons - *Lock screen posters are autoupdated. Unable to modify its settings as it's inaccessible, which is quite irritating. Attached the video.
*Feedback app is there , where u can write compliants and attach the images. I provided my fb twice about the photo issues mentioned in point 1 with images. But no response from them. So I felt it's like an eye wash.

5. Weight :
Phone is heavy to hold. Due to which it's highly slippery. The provided glossy back cover has no grip for Antifall. I ended up buying an anti slippery stickers for back cover.

6. Price :
This cell is 40k, which is over value. Does not value for the hype.

Initially I thought this phone is going to be a market leader after OnePlus.
I am a regular OnePlus user (1+2, 1+6t) . After switching to iQoo, i changed my opinion now!
My rating would be 3.5/5.

Review_title: Buy this phone only if u know it well
Review_text:
First of all there is no headphone jack in the phone.But that's ok since every android company now days copying iphone and skipping it.But other OEMs are giving the typce c converter in the box as a compensation but with iQoo 7 legend u will not get that also. U have to buy it separately to use ur 3.5mm headphone and to get the optimal performance of The Built in Dac Hi-Fi u have to buy an expensive converter to get optimal output of sound.
Secondly the phone gets hot in extreme usage conditions even if they are advertising that there is largest vapour chamber but it is of no use if ur using it in its full potential.
At last the performance is good but the Os is bit downside,coz we are not getting the origin os of china but we are getting the fun touch os of vivo phones which is not up to the mark, it is not bad but still not good as origin os of china.
And lastly the legend has only 5 ,5G bands which might be concern for some people as it is not sufficient.
Thirdly the camera is good for the price.
Fourthly, Don't expect good battery life as it is paired with only 4000mah cell which is not sufficient for power hungry sd 888 SoC during my usage I am getting 4-5 hours of screen on time without gaming.
The phone is not bad for the price but not the best out there.
Conclusion: If u want SD 888 in any cost and performace go with it But if u want stable performance then u should look for something Else as 888 has a lot of heating issue.

Review_title: Good features but level of customization could have been better
Review_text:
I moved from a OnePlus 3T to this device and for me it seems like a downgrade even though this device has higher secs and latest tech! The below review is based on a couple of days usage.

The only good part - The camera is good, haven't used a lot of features while clicking the pictures but in my limited use the picture quality is good.
And you won't get a SD888 (other one being Mi 11X Pro) at this price range.

Now comes the negatives/annoying features and for me there are quite a few....
1. The level of customization that one can do on a OP is way more, e.g. - changing the display size, which I don't see in iQOO - here you can only change the font size, high level of wastage of the screen real estate!
2. The volume of the earpiece as well as the speaker is pretty low, so expect to face some issues when taking calls outside of your home environment.
3. Battery support is good but it drains very fast when using the mobile hotspot.
4. The amount of bloatware is pretty annoying. And to top it up there is no way to get rid of it! Why in well would I use their browser or clumsy messaging App?

Amazon has changed it's policy so there is no way to return the device, so alas I will have to keep using it. Hopefully I will be able to add more to the positive list at a later point in time.

Review_title: Not a legend, but a good device with few unfixable flaws
Review_text:
Negatives:
Speaker Voulme: It is noticeably low compared to Oneplus 9, S21 Plus and even Samsung M51. Speaker is biggest ket down. U cannot enjoy any videos as the volume is very low. U end up using headphones or BT speaker everytime. Call volume is better than media volume.

Font Size: Even with largest font size selection, letters size are very small and look very bad on the big screen. Even after downloading paid fonts from playstore and iqoo store, the size is not increasing. We can only change font style but not size.

Camera:
Front Selfie Camera: Average looking shots; background is overexposed. Even after 2 updates issue is still present. After zooming selfies look grainy. Not worth the hype
Rear Camera: Macro shots are a hit and miss. Sometimes we get very good macros and sometimes they wont.
Overall rear camera consistency is not good even after 2 updates.

SLIPPERY MOBILE AND SLIPPERY CASE: Both the handset and even the case provided in the box have no grip and is very easy to slip from the hands. Though the case quality is very good and looks stylish, it has zero grip and is useless. I had to buy another grippy case. The handset also has no grip at all.

USER INTERFACE:
Average UI, nothing fancy.

Apart from these all other features are very good, particularly charging speed is excellent. Superb quality Amoled screen. Battery backup is good. Signal and call quality reception is very good. Games are running buttery smooth.

If you are buying this device for gaming than don't buy it. If you play while charging the battery charge percent will not increase at all. You have to close the game and charge it. Apart from this there are thousands of bugs in the is itself. Sometime keyboard does not appear and you have to restart the phone. Sometime status bar does not shows the phone hangs. It Cleears all the default apps on its own. Totally frustrated with this phone.

Lots of bloatwear(ads) decent camera..
Battery cannot last all day with 120hz Or even smart switch if more use but 20min full charge so no issues..
Bloatwear ka issues nahi hai to le lo good for gaming too bgmi 90fps stable no frame drops

Value for money product but lots of room to improve.
Pros:
Killer processor SD888 for am attractive price.
Absolutely loved the flash charge.
Good sound quality.
Decent build quality.
Super fast indisplay finger print reader.
Cons:
Display - Most of the Indian YouTubers has rated that the phone has best display, but I am really disappointed with the display quality. The whites are not that bright enough and looks bit cheap. Even I do have the green tint issue but in practical cases it is perfectly alright. U won't notice it much.
Weight and size - The phone feels bit over weight in the hand and it is difficult to reach the corners with one hand. I feel the company should have reduced the screen size. My opinion is biased as I prefer compact phones but the sad thing is no compact phones are in android market now. So iqoo if u are watching this please do consider making compact phones and there are lots of people like me
No headphone jack - When u call a gaming phone I feel it's necessary to provide a dedicated headphone jack.
Missing pure android experience - The stock android skin on my pixel 2 is still the best android UI I have ever experienced. I don't use the bloatware from funtouch OS and not satisfied with its look.

Review_title: IQOO 7 is better then IQOO &Legend, i regret i bought iqoo 7 legend .
Review_text: Go for some other brand like OnePlus or iPhone. This is not a good smartphone, it has a lot of features i agree. But fail to perform though it has peek feature. Dual vibration sensors are waste . No use. , You can play just 4 bgmi games you'll phone will heatup like anything and batttey goes down like anything.

This phone was advertised everywhere as gaming phone but trust me its not a gaming phone. The SD 888 processor is just to show on papers. I am a pro Asphalt 9 player and this phone can't handle this game for even 10 minutes. You will see frame drops even after 5 minutes. I thought this game might not be optimised for this game so I have tested BGMI and frame drops were there too. The only thing I loved in this phone is 120hz refresh rate and fast charging (full charge in less than 30 minutes). Camera is decent.
Please don't buy this phone for gaming purpose. Save some money and go for Rog 5.

Review_title: No custom rom support and bad ergonomics!
Review_text:
DO NOT BUY IF YOU WANT CUSTOM ROMS. It's OS is not good but can get the job done.

Very bad ergonomics, heavy on the hands. My old oneplus 6t feels so light and very ergonomic. The specs are amazing but let down by a low capacity battery.
Charging is really a flash and the most impressive feature. Until now I was very happy with the Dash charger on the Oneplus but this blows it out of the water. If you keep waiting for the charging to get to 100% then this is the phone to get. Within 30 min you get a full charge from 0.

The pressure screen is ok, it does respond very well, takes some getting used to. However once you get used to them it's very helpful in gaming.

But iqoo7 legend gave the best specs there is that's why i bought it. But sometimes you don't need best of everything. In end phone will be a phone. You may change it every year. But you will realise that next week another variant or some brand's phone will come with better specs.
Bugs in many apps

Review_text: It's been over a month since I have used this phone. The UI of this is buggy. Not stable. And yes.. Green tint that everyone is complaining about is another bug in the UI. 2.Battery is not worthy for this price range.They should atleast replace this battery with other battery with high capacity.
3. Very high speed.
4. Mobile will not get hang even after using high end applications.

Review_title: Premium build, good charging speed: Rest all crap.
Review_text:
IQoo7 legend.
Pros:
1. Solid & premium build
2. Latest SoC SD 888 waste for non gamers.
3. Great looks
4. Fast charging 0 to100% in just under 25 minutes.
5. Good rear camera in day light.
7. No heating issues on general use.

Cons:
1. Really heavy 206 gms, very difficult to handle in one hand.
2. Small battery for the weight, just 4000mah,
3. Very poor battery back up. Hardly lasts 8 to 10 hours with normal use.
4. Too much of bloatware, u can't uninstall or disable.
5. Funtouch 11is a poor UI
6. Absence of key features like file safe/private safe folder,
7. Highly complicated UI. Worst in the market.
8. In screen finger print scanner placed too low, n sluggish. Not user friendly.
9. Absence of 3.5mm jack
10. Poor quality back cover provided. Highly slippery.
After one weeks usage:
1. Worst phone. Never buy this crap.
All-new phone with SD888 hangs on day 7 and nothing u can operate barring volume button. Power button stuck to Emergency call n will not be able to re-start or power off.
Then no option but to force start.
2. Bad cameras in low light.
3. Due to weight very difficult to operate in one hand.
4. Very poor battery life.
5. I don't know what all information they collect. Every basic function asks for permission to gather personal information.
6. As a wellwisher my advice, please don't buy, if you have bought one return or replace it soon.
After 10days of usage:
1. Poor network connectivity
2. When you're on a call, an incoming call will light up d screen, n proximity sensor stops working, so either ur call is disconnected, or some unwanted action performed.
3. Very poor speaker volume n clarity
4. After few minutes into call, the call quality gradually drops, n need to struggle to hear.
5. Upper border of display has black tint needing aliasing SW n tweaking
6. Unless 1/3 rd of the phone is above your ear pinna, proximity sensors doesn't work, screen keeps lighting.
7. If you are using connected to say Bluetooth in car, once you get out of the car, or BT interrupted, call doesn't get transferred to phone speakers, trust me phone hangs.
8. With ongoing call, you can't switch to an incoming call, phone hangs.
9. This crap is with full of bugs.
So, friends, one of the worst products. Think 100 times before buying!!!

Pros:
1. Good and unique design
2. Camera is decent and 2x zoom is pretty good
3. For gaming like BGMI it is good. Heavy games like genshin impact sucks.
4. Charges in 24 mins from 3% to 100%
5. Cheap price (32k in republic sale)

Cons:
1. Phone is heavy and slippery to hold even with case. No gorilla glass. So no protection.
2. Snapdragon 888 has much heating issue even with normal use. Can't hold the phone because of aluminium frame gets heated like hell.
3. Very bad battery backup if heavy user. Atleast charge 2 times a day. 4000 mah for SD 888 chip is very less.
4. Funtouch UI is the worst ever. Too much bloatwares and each asking to agree to terms and agreement which takes our data.
5. Lagging a lot in first few days. YouTube gets struck often.
6. No 3.5mm jack. No cable for type c to 3.5 mm is provided in box.
7. Phone can't be rooted and rom can't be cchanged in all IQoo and Vivo.So can't fix the ROM on your own too.

Overall conclusion :

Buy this phone if comes to cheap price. Choose IQOO 7 which is 10k price difference but has same screen, camera, big battery and 870 processor which is way lot cooler and stable than 888.

It's fast due to SD 888 processor, everything else is disappointing. Experience is really bad due to poor Funtouch OS. It's so bad that it doesn't even allow you to change accent color. You are stuck with boring same looking UI forever. Vivo/Iqoo doesn't even allow you to unlock bootloader so you can never install custom roms which means that you will have to bear with the funtouch os forever. Trust me, OS is so bad that it overpowers every good thing about this phone.
Other observations after 4 months usage:

Pros:
Decent camera in day light
Fast Charging
Good Display
Good for gaming due to SD888 but multitasking is poor as it keeps closing apps in the background

Cons:
Worst software experience I have ever seen on a mobile
Buggy UI, boring grey color notification panel with no support to change accent color
Useless software updates with no useful features - This was IQOO's top model at the time of purchase yet such poor software support
Poor calling quality - Wifi calling keeps dropping during calls, people on the other side of the call keeps complaining about the poor audio. I have changed router, have 100MBPS plan yet wifi calling is always a hit and miss on this phone. Proximity sensor is also not optimised, sometimes screen turns on during calls automatically and sometimes it doesn't even when you want it to.

It has high rating here on amazon because company gave free screen replacement offer for writing a review on amazon and most of the people gave positive reviews for that.

NOT RECOMMENDED TO BUY AT ALL.
