Review_title: Overall a very good & all-round smartphone
Review_text:
To begin with - I fell in love with the phone the moment i saw it (online and on YouTube). I went through multiple reviews before I decided to buy it (for my 14 year old son):
THE PROS
1. The specs are tremendous - a snapdragon 888 & 12 gigs of RAM (with an additional 3 on tap). While it is a performance phone (ideal for gamers) it can also be used for daily use. Plus there's 120 Hz on tap which makes scrolling / gaming / videos a breeze! Add the additional haptic feedback for gaming.
2. It has the equivalent of Gorilla Glass 4 / 5 (a German glass brand that is less well known but equally good). It already comes with tempered glass on it - which is great!
3. But above and beyond the specs and the ratings - what blows you completely is the actual physical form-factor of the phone. It is delightful - it is big and it is on the heavier side (takes some getting used to).
4. It has a solid build - like a brick. You could literally knock someone out cold with it.
5. The finish with the white back and the BMW M stripes are beautiful. It's matt so it will not be a finger-print magnet.
6. The build quality is also incredible. While this may sound subjective - let me put it in perspective. I use a S21 Plus and a OnePlus 7T and my daughter uses a S20 FE. This phone's physical form factor in terms of its build quality is as good as any of these phones.
7. The speakers are great - better than my S21 Plus that costs double this phone.
8. The camera is very good - not as good at the S20 FE or the S21 Plus but better than the OnePlus 7T. It's night mode is very good and normal portrait shots in the day are vivid and punchy (a little on the oversaturated side - like Samsung).
THE CON(S)
1. The lack of a IP rating is unfortunate but basis my tests, it is definitely splash resistant (also something you can corroborate off YouTube reviews).
2. The battery is 4000 Mah so it is unlikely that it'll last a day with even normal use. The saving grace is its huge 67 watt charger that actually charges this phone from 0 to 100 in 25 mins (yes - 25 mins - no exaggeration on that one). Normally people will not wait for their battery to drain out completely - usually plugging it when it reaches 25% or so. Which will take no more than 15 mins to charge!
3. The silicon case that comes in the box is good but very slippery. But another one if you have to - one with grooved edges that make holding the phone easy.
4. The OS is rudimentary and there is bloatware (some of the unnecessary apps can be deleted). Nowhere close to OxygenOS or even Samsung's OneUI. But personally I don't think this is a deal-breaker.

VERDICT - Like i mentioned earlier...while I bought this for my son, i was very tempted to buy another one for myself. In my opinion, the pros far out-compensate the cons. It is a phone that I would unhesitatingly recommend to those who appreciate great design; build quality & great specs!!! And it comes at a great price :))
This mobile was surprised

Well i cannot say much as I just bought this phone for gaming purpose but wasn't aware that the hardware which is inside this device Is capable of so much more. In terms of gaming you can pick any phone from any price range from market and it will match that performance without any issue. Yes it has some heating problem but it's the know problem with every snapdragon 888 chipset phone even one plus 9 pro has heating issue. Yes it less compared to 7 legend because of simple fact that those phone's performance are locked and this can be checked in benchmarking application score.

Also don't worry about the heat it has the biggest cooling chamber till now in any phone. So you will be blown away with the cooling speed of this phone. It literally drops 4-5°c in 2-3 mins of inactivity.

In terms of camera pick any phone in this price point 7 legend will out perform them.

Let's talk about battery yes it's 4000mah a little less but it won't disappoint you. I play almost 7-8 pubg games in a day in SMOOTH and 90FPS setting so around 4hrs of gaming along with Instagram and watsapp the phone is connected to wifi 24X7 and for audio i use Bluetooth headset, and guess what i have to charge it twice a day.

So my suggestion is go for it if you budget is around 30-40k as there is card discount too and great replacment offers.

CONS : The only problem right now in the phone is it's UI. IT'S GREAT but there are few bugs because of which you will be disappointed. This can be fixed and IQOO if you're listening please give us some fixes on the UI quickly. I know one plus iqoo Vivo all are Chinese brand so do some magic and ship this phone with OXYGEN OS😂 and trust me your phone's will be king in its price segment.

NOTE : You will only be disappointed if you get a defective unit which is possible. But you can always replace it during the replacement period.

If you are looking for a mobile under 40k then don't think of other options. This is surely the best you can get under 40k. I will now explain Pros and cons of this so that you all can get better idea.
Pros:-
1. Display
This is one of the best displays we can get at this price.colours and brightness are excellent. Indisplay fingerprint is also pretty good and accurate.120hz refresh rate gives you much smoother experience.
2. Build Quality
Coming to build quality,the in-hand feel looks premium. Front and back it has glass protection and frame is aluminium.so iqoo hasn't compromised anything in build quality point of view.
3. Performance
Coming to performance,it has the best processor (sd 888) right now in the market. Any high end games like COD, Asphalt 9 it handles very well . No lags or frame drops.
4. Cooling System
This is also the best thing Iqoo has done. the cooling system is so good that after 40-45 mins of gaming also the cpu thermal management is so good.it feels a bit warm outside but not that much.
5. Battery and Fast charging
It comes with 4000mah battery and with 66w fast charger we can charge it completely under 27 mins. Moderate user can use this phone for 1 day with full charge. I got Screen on time around 6 hrs.
6. Camera
Last but not the least, this is one of the reason why I went for this compared to other competitors in this price like OnePlus 9R or Mi11x pro. 48 mp main camera does excellent job in day light or low light. Another advantage is 13mp wide angle camera .this can also be used for taking macro pics .so macro pics are quite amazing compared to other phones having 2mp or 5mp macro camera. The main advantage of cameras is 13mp portrait telephoto lens . You can really capture amazing portrait pics. It also has modes in portrait which are amazing. Coming front camera, it has 16 mp front camera which does the good job as well.
7. Virtual Ram Technology.
This is also one of the best feature you get in this phone.3gb of your internal storage can be used as Ram.

Cons:-
Every mobile has obviously has some cons. Now let us see the cons I have noticed In my usage.
1. Stereo speakers.
It doesn't have a dedicated secondary speaker at the top.Earpiece acts as a secondary speaker.it could have been better if they have provided that dedicated speaker at the top.
2. Mic Quality in video recording.
This is the con for the people who records videos much. Audio recorded via mic is bit low.
3. Ui
When compared to previous versions of funtouch os present version is pretty good but its not that good compared with oxygen os
4. No micro sd card slot
Yes flagships won't give you that option.so you have to stick with the internal storage or you can use otg.
5. No IP rating
As this is the flagship so they could have given atleast IP53 rating but it's not. Though the slots have that rubber seal inside but rating could have added a bit more value for this phone.
6. No reverse charging or wireless charging support.

All these cons are not much of concerns for most of the people so this is the best falgship killer under 40k.

Review_title: Overall a good spec heavy mobile but lags in software
Review_text:
I have been using this mobile for almost 2 months. Bought this mobile after a through research.
My previous mobile was Samsung Note 9.
I don't play games but I am a heavy user with lots of apps and inclined towards performance. It irritates me when phone becomes slow and gets stuck. User reviews has helped me to take a decision and thought to share mine as well for others benefit

My requirements:
Best performace without any lags and can sustain for atleast 3 years
Good camera
Battery
Software exp

Below is my experience

Pros
-Absolutely fantastic with hardware. No lags.
-Camera is too good
-Signal reception is good in both network connectivity and Wifi connectivity.
-Display is good.
- Battery is good. Easily works for one day. Gets charged in almost 35 mins. So no problem at all.
- Did not face any heating issue. Though I don't play games but I use lots of apps. My samsung note 9 used to get heated at some point.
- Mobile Speaker quality is good. Not very loud but audio clarity is good. This is enough

Cons
- Biggest drawback is in software. This mobile just has a basic software so that u can use this mobile. After using samsung note 9, I feel this is lagging way too behind. Some of the annoying problems are

- Phone dialer too bad. UI is pathetic and there is no search option in call history. Problem is even Google Phone dialer from playstore does not work in this mobile. Using it everyday really irritates.
- Cannot watch any of OTT Vidoes on TV screen by screen casting. Videos don't play on TV screen. Here Samsung works brilliantly.
- Cannot group apps in a folder. With so may apps it looks like a junk yard
- No in built file manager. Downloading some file manger from playstore will never be perfect. They have given so many bloatwares. I don't know why they did not give one file manager.
- While Connected with bluetooth there is no option to select audio output channel. Sometimes I may need from bluetooth or phone audio or wired audio. This is really problematic while screen casting. Again samsung works brilliantly.
- No Bluetooth connectivity interface. Everytime have to go to settings to connect
- Limited options to customize themes. Mostly themes just change color. No major changes.

Apart from all these, have faced call drops a few times but that's not a very big concern. Mostly it works.

Overall- I would rate 4.5. It is a good spec heavy mobile but lags way behind in software. I will still suggest as it gives performance without any lags. If software aspects are improved, this is the best in market.
Also priced decently.

Review_title: Great performer with great camera and very beautiful design!
Review_text:
Iqoo has given a really very powerful packed smartphone in very low price.
I personally bought it for its performance and fast charging.
I am reviewing this phone after 2 months of rough use.
This phone is really very very powerful. It can run really very heavy apps without any issues. No matter weather you are playing a heavy game or editing a video, you can totally rely on it.
I had not much expectations with its camera as it has got enough specifications for its price. But it came out to be really really good. I was shoked by its extreme night mode, portrait mode UHD photos and 4k 60fps video recording. I can always relay on it that no matter what the lighting condition is, it will always delight me by its photos.
Its screen is just superb! 120hz refresh rate makes your experience fluid with great colours , super fast touch response, extreme brightness and benefits of amoled display.
Haptic feedback on this phone is super cool when typing messages or when playing games. It makes the experience better.
I love its pressure sensitive trigger buttons for games. Like I use them to fire in BGMI. I don't have to move my thumb, just put some pressure on the screen.
Stereo speakers and amazing on this phone. Very crispy and balanced with a little thumping bass feel!
Battery life on this phone is good but its 66watt charging makes it great. Sometimes when the battery is low during gaming, I just plug it in the charger and go for a 10 min walk. And when I come back, I'm good to go for hours!!! 100% charge in just 27 minutes is really really great. I never have to worry.
Face unlock in this phone works really well even in very low lighting conditions! I'm delighted with it. And when the lighting conditions are good, it will unlock your phone as soon as you press the power button!
Fingerprint sensor is not very great as it is not the fastest I've ever seen but it's still very good though.
I love it's UI. It has loads of customisation options. Totally love its animations!
And at last, its design.... It is a very beautiful phone. It feels premium as you hold it in your hands. Its white colour with BMW brand strips make it look really cool. And its all covered by a matte finish glass back which makes the in-hand feel very good and protects it from fingerprints.
It's not a very heavy phone. And it feels very good to hold in hands.
I bet you, you won't find a better phone than this in this price range. Just go for it!!!

Review_title: Worth Buying  - best for gaming, Photography and performance.
Review_text:
Definitely a great choice for the users looking for camera and optimized day to day performance. phone's ram management is so impressive.
No phones in the market stands in front of its camera under this price segment. Awesome camera quality.
Display is very crisp and sharp with 120hz Refresh rate HDR videos viewing quality take you to another level.
A+ Gaming Support.
impressive fast charging.
And at the last its design is definitely unique and awesome that never seen before even in the flagship level smart phones that color changing display.
i really recommend my friends to buy iqoo smartphones.

An Amazing Smartphone for 35k, writing this review after 10 days of continuous usage.

Build - It has one of the most unique design for a smartphone, the back and front are glass sandwiched with an aluminium frame, the camera bump is minimal plus it has extra antenna bands for good connectivity.

Hardware - The sd 888 on this legend is highly overpowered with no corner cut, I gamed for 3 hours straight and the heating was minimal and there were no lags, the heating chamber is really good to minimize the heat while heavy tasking.

Display - 120 Hz Fhd display on first look may look normal on first glance but it has higher contrast ratio which gives even better punchy colours. My unit has no green tint issue.

Camera - being launched as gaming smartphone it has really good camera setup 48+13+13 is a triple camera setup but works as quad camera with ultrawide also working as macro thus no useless 2 mp camera unlike most of smartphones in this price range. Front camera is 16 MP and is good enough and finely tuned for good detailed photos.

Gaming - 10/10 absolute beast in terms pf gaming

Battery - 4000Mah may look less for a gaming phone at first glance but i easily got regular 5 hours of gaming at hdr extreme settings. For normal usage it's gives you easy one day battery. Charging is absolutely phenomenon on this device in my usage it always took less than 25 min for full charge.

Connectivity - real nice connectivity for 4G, I got 40 Mbps plus in my village for LTE Network, it has carrier aggregation and works well if the place supports it.

Audio - This might be the only drawback of this phone. It has dual stereo speakers, sound quality is good but loudness is a little low, it doesn't has 3.5 mm jack but through adapter it supports high res audio which provide excellent output.

Software - funtouch os 11 is really improved the software is really stable the only irritating part is bloatware and vivo app store which send ads which you should turn off in the beginning

Additional - a little tip while you boot this smartphone for first time do check every agreement at the startup, for reference check 'beeboom' video for different os for clean setup.

Overall a great phone for the price segment worth the buy and not disappointed at all.

Review_title: Value for money when compared with One plus (Any version)
Review_text:
Pros:
Super Duper performance
No heating
Ultra-fast charging (0 to 100 in 19mins)

Had an option to adjust the percentage of background blur and also the option to add effects

Cons:
not so much attracted to fun touch OS when compared with Oxygen OS
Unused apps (Where I couldn't have an option to uninstall)

I have been using this product for the past 3 months and this has lived upto my expectations.
Camera quality is superb and if you know how to play with pro settings in camera, u can get pretty good results in low light and night time.
Battery life is above average I would say.
Gaming performance is very good. I play CoD, PUBG, sideswipe at highest FPS and processor can handle them very well. It gets a bit warmer when playing for long hours.
There is a slight delay in fingerprint scanner but u can substitute it for Face ID which is very fast. Charging time is also very good.
Display is nice and crisp.
Stereo speakers are bang-on
There are few bugs in funtouch OS, I really miss the stock android.
I got this smartphone for 34k. Its a pretty good smart and if you compare it with the new 9 SE just go for 7 legend. It's pretty much same.

Superb camera..
Excellent gaming experience..
Battery full only in 20 minutes and continuesly last upto 6 hours with heavy gaming..

Review_title: It's not perfect but still one of the best you can get at this price
Review_text:
I have extensively used MI phones earlier so I will post my reply keeping them as benchmark.
Pros
- This phone handles sd888 better than anything, no heating whatsoever
- A lot of people will tell you that sd888 is a waste for you if you are not a gamer.... This is wrong, it enhances your overall experience and a flagship processor is must if you want to own a phone for >2yrs (as per my experience)
- Amoled screen is awesome and animations are very smooth with adaptive refresh rate, no need to keep it at 120hz always
- Pictures are awesome, just install gcam, it takes 5 minutes and will deliver quality pics for years (my apk doesn't have the dedicated zoom switch, not sure if they are supporting zoom lense)
- Charging is super fast, 0 to 100 in less than 25 mins and it doesn't heat the battery a lot, not missing the 120 watt charger at all
- If you have a 3G sim (BSNL), then it has a 3G only mode which works much better than 3G preferred mode in Mi phones
- Supports 5 5G bands so it's definitely not a gimmick here
- My device doesn't have any issues with the call hold lags or any calling issue, maybe it was fixed in the latest update
- Build quality is awesome due to the aluminium frame, feel premium
- comes with a screen protector pre installed
- fingerprint reader is decent

Cons
- Heavy to hold, if you have small hands consider something else or buy a grippy cover
- Battery is small although battery life does seem decent
- Funtouch OS is not all that fun, but you can uninstall all the bloatware except 2 (not considering the optimization apps, calculator etc), these 2 can also be reduced to mere icons within a few clicks. Jovi home also needs to be ignored.
- I miss the headphone jack and they didn't give a covertor in box
- Pressure sensitivity is not used anywhere apart from games

Overall, you need to put some effort to make it better it's not perfect but the best you can get at this price ( always buy with that 3k/2k coupon offer)
i loved this phone

Review_title: Best value for money phone with Top performance!
Review_text:
I switched to this phone from Samsung Note 20 Ultra which was 3 times the price by the way. Most worrying point for me was camera quality at time of purchase since i knew that IQOO 7 legend has the best in market - SD888 chip, so performance will not be an issue at all.

Phone is superb when it comes to charging time = 22-24 minutes from 1% to 100%. I have timed it several times and it charges consistently. (Don't use the phone in this time though, otherwise it will take more time to charge).

Camera = IQOO 7 legend takes pretty ready to use photos which do not require any/much editing. Its AI is also nice to take best optimized photos as per the scene/lighting around.

Video recording = Its very stable and satisfactory till 1080p (30 and 60 fps), however 4k could be improved. It lacks OIS stabilization in 4k...its a much needed feature since the chip inside can even support upto 8k recording, so i hope we get this issue sorted out through software update later.

Battery life = Average - i get around 4 hours screen on time while phone is charged almost every 22-24 hours. I expected better battery life but its fast charging makes things even, so won't complain much.

Build quality = Solid. Premium. Made of aluminium. Sturdy build.

Display = Brightness is right at flagship level and as good as my Note 20 Ultra which says a lot good about IQOO 7 legend's display. I have no complaints from it.

Audio = Dual speakers are Average. They could have been louder.

To conclude, if you are getting IQOO 7 legend 12 GB variant for Rs.40000 (after coupon/discount/cashback etc.), then its a pretty good deal in my opinion and i find it a true value for money phone especially when compared to OnePlus 9 Pro or Mi 11 Ultra or Vivo x60 Pro+ ....all these phones literally cost Rs.20,000 - 30000 more and don't really add much to such a big difference in the cost honestly.

Review_title: The Real legend is here now.
Review_text:
As I am using iQoo 7 legend 12GB RAM 256GB storage SD-888. The IQoo 7 legend it's real legend each an everything in this smartphone amazing awesome & superb.

1. Weight and size of this set is amazing, every time when I touch I feel awesome. Display & Legendary track Design mate finish back side with BMW brand color is superb.

2. Performance of this phone as iQoo committed with audience before launch, I got the same 120 refresh rate & High speed performance I like the most, one touch is enough to make you wish fullfil, application, files, setting tools and some other background setting very easy & simple with iQ.

3. Battery life 🔋 4000MAH is enough to perform and just 20 minutes is enough to charge 0-100%. I absorbed that all day my data is on all application is on even the battery conception is very low with high performance.

4. Artificial intelligence of this smartphone is one of the best thing, it will show you automatically, how to perform or how to use some other applications time to time according to your use.

5. Camera of iQ, I would like to say it just awesome as I want, 48MP IOS ultimate in this camera front & rear camera 📷 there is too many functions available to gives you best photography experience I am surprised with this.

6. SD-888 it's real performance I feel awesome.

7. Finger print reader is very smooth just one touch to unlock with this face unlock functions is also great.

8. Duel stereo speakers sound I like most with headphones or without headphones will enjoy awesome sound quality.

Review_title: Great Phone if you can get it around 35k or below.
Review_text:
Been using this for 6 days now. And I have only one regret but I doubt this will be applicable to overwhelming majority of buyers. Let's get that out of the way first, I like rooting my phones, sadly this can't be rooted as Vivo is a one of the most egregious offenders of open source nature of Android and won't allow bootloader unlock. But their value oriented Sub brand iQoo has come a long way from iQoo 3 days.

This phone is undoubtedly the best value for money flagship at a prmeum mid-range price available right now. Got it for less than 35k with discounts. Wanted to wait for realme GT but they seem to be taking their sweet time to release that phone in Indian market. That being said let me sum up the review with list of pros and cons.

Pros:
1. Flagship Snapdragon Processor
2. Great camera hardware setup with OIS.
3. Premium build and design.
4. Premium looking 120Hz OLED screen5
5. Clear and loud call quality and very good cellphone signal reception. So good internet speeds. Suports wifi 6 as well.
5. A lot more improved and Closer to Stock Android UI.
6. Great Haptics.
7. Sufficiently loud and clear stero speakers.

Cons.
1. Lack of 3.5 mm jack so can't utilize that Hi-Res onboard DAC with earphones.
2. Front camera processing softens/beautifies human skin for no reason, hope iQoo fixes this with an update in future.
3. Relatively small battery capacity for 2021 standards , surprisingly it's cheaper sibling iQoo 7 gets 10% better battery capacity than this. The fast charging speed makes up for it though so not that big of a con.
4. No SD card slot.
5. No OIS for video, this is baffling omission but doesn't affect my usage as I rarely shoot videos and even in those rare cases I won't be missing it as I won't be shooting it while runnig or something, so this con is at the very last.
Everything about the phone from look to camera is perfect. Except the battery 🔋 life which could have been some what better..rest fast charging is fine gets charged very fast.

Review after one week of use.

I love gaming and have been waiting for a SDM 888 under 40k which does not compromise on any aspect, and now i finally have it in my hands and its a Gaming Beast.

The super 1000 Hz touch sampling rate makes up for buttery smooth game control. For all mobile gamers, pls have a look at the touch sampling rate as that determines more your response times, even more than screen refresh rate.

Camera Again, since I love making travel videos, and have been using an iPhone 11 for the past one year, this has been a welcome change, with its saturated and punchy images and videos that are a treat to the eye. For vlogs in outdoor scenarios, audio used to become an issue, however zoom feature really helps reduce background noise and focus on the subject. No need to carry a separate mic!

I have always liked soft bright colors on my gadgets and so like the legend's aesthetic look. Considering the hardware it packs the phone is surprisingly light and slim.

As for the user interface which is Funtouch OS. this phone has the cleanest version of Funtouch OS yet. However being a nerd, I never shy away from the plethora of custom ROMs that popular devices get over at XDA, and this I am sure is going to be a blockbuster one. SO that's something up to try in the future!!

Not getting good brand type c earphones to use with it. So 3.5 mm earphone with a local type c connector doing the job as of now.
Humble request to iqoo to have typeC earphones, type C splitter and type c aux cable assesories in store to purchase by the users. I know at this price providing them with phone is not possible so kindly add it to your store for purchase separately.

Generally, when I buy a phone it's with the consideration that I'm going to use it for atleast the next 3-5 years. So it is quite a task to find one which is a value proposition and can last well all those years.
I'm an occasional gamer but more importantly, I needed a mobile computing device that can efficiently handle all my official, multimedia and general requirements.
You'll find many YouTubers mention it's tech specs in quite a lot of detail, so I'm just gonna stick to my experience of using the device.

What I really LIKE about this phone:
1. Excellent Screen - very good and vibrant colours, real viewing pleasure.
2. Sound - Though I've read some people commenting here that the sound is average, in my opinion, it's Loud, Clear and Crisp. The max volume level is good enough and did not notice any audio distortions even at the highest volume.
3. Camera - Loads of features to explore, experiment and better your shots. The "Mirror Image" option while taking selfies (even in video mode) is useful.

What can be IMPROVED:
1. Battery - With very normal usage too, I'm getting just about a day's backup. Though the FlashCharge feature is great, it would have been better if the battery size was 4500 mAh atleast.
2. Keyboard - I find the arrangement of the keys is slightly crunched up. Maybe it's because I'm still getting used to it.
2. Case/Cover - The flexible cover that comes with the phone is good and has good aesthetic appeal. However, it's quite SLIPPERY and I fear that my phone may drop off. Hence, had to get another one.

Haven't played much games yet, will update this review when I do.

In conclusion, it's a real beauty as you get flagship specs without compromising on future connectivity. Hopefully, it'll be 5G compliant when it's launched in India. Happy with the device.

I upgraded from Redmi K20 pro. This device is a performance beast. Better than any device in this price range. Great build quality. In gameing I play only PUBG and the device really performs great and I experienced no heating issues. I think the vapour chamber works really well. Display is very crisp and bright. Cameras are at flagship level. And the Battery lasts a day on moderate usage and drains on gameing but its ok becoz the charging is incredibly fast and that makes it even. I got confused is it really 100 or not.
.
My friend have a onplus 9R and this phone outperforms in every department except battery. U get roughly 30 to 40 mins extra on oneplus 9R but the charging outperforms. 9R can't match with the gaming and camera performance. Coming to software i actually like the software experience becoz I want that gameing mode and all becoz during gameing especially pubg i use wats app.
.
Coming to design its totally subjective and I personally like the design as am a BMW fanboy and it will stand you out in a crowd.
.
Phone is on the heavier side. But it's ok for me becoz it gives good in hand feel. Premium phones all are heavy. Not good for one hand usage.
.
I recommend this phone for gamers and age below 30 years.
.
The protection case is very slippery and no protection for the cameras. you might want to change the case.
.
Battery is very good but not best in 2021.
Over all its a great product. Well done IQOO. Will update after 2 month usage.

Good things😃
AMOLED display😃
120Hz refresh rate support for screen😃
Flagship performance with Snapdragon 888🥰
8GB RAM onboard🤗
Versatile rear camera😊
Long battery life😁
66W fast charging supported🤩

Bad things😡
No headphone jack🥵
Lacks memory card slot🤧
Average front camera (like selfie 👹👺🥶)

(One major problem I was found within 3 days used, actually phone automatically switch on and off, but after i was read iqoo website instructions problem is solved.
What should I do if my phone switches on/off suddenly?
Please don`t worry, here are some helpful methods for you:

1. Go to Settings>Shortcuts and Accessibility>Task timer to check if you have scheduled the power-off time;

2. Update your phone to the latest version;

3. Close apps running in the background more often;

4. Remove apps infrequently used;

5. Go to i Manager>Space cleanup(management), clear Cache junk more often;

6. If it happens frequently, please access Settings>System management>Backup & Reset>Erase all data>Clear now(You will lose all the data on your phone, let it be the last step you try and backup all you data before the operation);

If above measures are not effective, please come to visit our service center, our engineers will help you fix it.)

I was following 6 number method and problem solved 🤩🤩🤩🤩🤩😍😍😍😍😍)

Otherwise phone is excellent except phone accessories not easily available in local market (like Mumbai) before buy keep it in mind😫, another think outbox phone case quality good but 2 much sleepring, so try to buy good case.

Value for money, I got it only on 28k After old phone exchange and Amazon 2k discount coupon with no cost emi ( awesome 😁🥰😘😍🤩😂)

Thank you Amazon and vivo Iqoo 7 team 👍

I have been an avid fan of OnePlus phones since they launched for the fact that they provided high performance Flagship level specs with minimal bloatware (Oxygen OS is closest to stock) at cutthroat prices. But lately they have upped the prices and have (unnecessarily) launched multiple variants while compromising on specs. This is where iQoo enters.
The iQoo 7 Legend is a fantastic piece of hardware at slightly better prices than OnePlus (once the prince of flagship killers). Camera doesn't disappoint either. Fingerprint scanner is better than expected and the phone unlocks within a fraction of a second. While the battery capacity could have been 4500mAh instead of 4000mAh, it's fast charging capabilitirs (0-100% in 30 mins approx) is the best I have seen till date. The only downside being the OS which has more bloatware compared to OnePlus which is a rather ignorable annoyance. But at the price it is being offered, I would prefer the iQoo over OnePlus.

Review_title: Value for money... The New OnePlus
Review_text: This is for those who are looking for high end specs with reasonable price... This is what OnePlus started off with but somehow lost track midway fighting for number one spot with big tech companies.... IQOO is filling up that sweet spot that OnePlus was supposed to capture... Perfomance is really good considering it has 888 snapdragon processor. In short look no further... This is a good buy if get it on discount now as there are updated versions available IQOO 9 etc....

Review_title: Amazing phone at an unbeatable price.
Review_text:
I was among the few people who pre ordered this device, used Amazon's ICICI credit card and availed 3000rs discount in addition to Amazon's 2000 rs discount, got this phone @35000, I have been using this phone for more than 1month and i really liked my decision of buying iqoo7 legend, have been a xiaomi user for quite sometime now, however i was attracted by the top notch specifications offered at an unbeatable price. Phone stands out in the crowd.
Pros:-
1)Processor- Snapdragon 888, performance is seemless.
2) camera- 48 mp camera is awesome, additional 13mp telephoto lens is a bliss, which other phones are not offering. They are offering either a macro or depth sensor. But its telephoto lens is portrait sensor too, wide lens is again an advantage. Whole camera set up is amazing.
3) charger - first of all they are offering a fast charger which is insane when it comes to charging your phone 0-100 in less than 30min. So now u dont need to worry about running out of juice when u can carry this charger with u.
4) looks- OMG, this phone is a stunner and stand-out in the crowd,the three stripes at the glass back is stunning and bmw branded back case is of ok quality but serves the purpose.
5) Display:- Amoled display is awesome, brightness is next level, no problem in operating the phone in direct sun light, display is crisp and punchy. 120hz makes the operation smoother.

Cons:-
few bugs are there, that can be sorted via an update and company is trying to fix it with timely updates.
Apart from that i am very much happy with my purchase and the value this phone is offering.

4.5/5
Overall good

Camera samples are uploaded
Night mode can do wonders if you use tripod
Camera 5/5 for this prize point
Camera app has bugs but nothing deal breaking

Performance and heat dissipation is good but due to overheating of 888 you will at times feel annoyed.
Performance 4/5 due to heating
Otherwise 888 at this prize is overall awesome

Ui is great. 5/5
You have recording feature and screen recording and all features you can ask for. No ads or bugs
But it gives you download app page when you download something from app store.

Battery 3/5 only because charing is fast otherwise battery won't last long enough.
Optimization is not good from battery point of view.
Charging is great though. I never plugged in for more than 20 mins. Believe me I don't think you need a more powerful charger. 66w is more than enough.

Looks 5/5
This is a design that stands out. One who knows this phone won't ask. They know. At the same time frosted glass back looks way better in hand than in pics. Believe me it's the best looking phone in the market.

Only thing I miss is headphone jack.
If I'm missing on it I would loved IP rating.
But prizes won't allow that.

If you wanna buy a phone below 40k. Go for it.

Great job IQOO
Please work a little more on ui polishing.
And battery Optimation.
Phone charge fast and also drain battery it is happening after 6 months (battery warranty for 6 months only) . If really need better battery life don't choose this phone.

Good solid looking heavy (206 grams) brick of a phone. It is quite slippery though.
Latest top of the line SoC SD 888. As I was pressed to make a purchase, though I do not game, I decided to future proof myself.
Fast charging 0 to 100% in just around 30 minutes. It should last a day.
In screen fingerprint scanner placed low but it registers fingerprint quite fast.
Dual speaker are good and loud enough. I do miss 3.5mm jack as I have a really good audiophile earphone that I would have liked to use. Phone is Hi-Fi Certified.
I do get round it using Bluetooth, which works well. One can change the settings to 'Optimized for Audio Quality (990kbps)' under Developer options for Bluetooth.
Screen is good. Camera Quality is good.

In regards to software, I am running PD2049F_EX_A_1.76.18
As a power user, I was able to clean up the bloatware.
Use a different Launcher and can configure the UI to my liking.
The UI is fluid thanks to the beefy processor.
I don't have the green tint issue.
As a OnePlus user for last few years, I only hope iQOO/ViVo keep the upgrades coming.
I think Android 12 is in the works. But I would hope for 2 more major releases are provided in the future.
Aspirational hope is to have Origin OS which should help with the amount of criticism about FunTouch OS.

Review_title: Best in all departments!! Super loving it
Review_text:
I almost took more than 1 month to purchase this product, due to hesitance in trying new brand. But after purchase, I am super happy and loving that I made a right choice.
Pros:
- Camera quality is best in the range
- Battery life for my daily usage is very good. Mostly around 50% of battery is consumed in whole day for me and charging time is super quick. Within 25mins to 30mins full charge from 0%. on new purchase Thats really quick. Daily I keep phone for charging around 10 to 15mins since I lost only 50 to 55% battery.
- Switching between the apps is real smooth.
- Network speed and browsing web is also quick.
- Look of the phone is a beauty to watch and behold.

Cons:
- Not with respect to phone anything, but only about the back cover accessory which is provided along with the phone. It is good, but slippery. Chances of slipping from hand is more using the provided back cover. Otherwsie with respect to phone, I didn't find anything to complain.

If anyone looking to purchase new phone with the amount of features it provides and the price which it is being selled at, I think without doubt you can purchase this phone and will not regret the choice you made.

Iqoo 7 Legend is really a wonderful device. I was using Oneplus device from a couple of years and it was very hard to shift from Oxygen OS. But watched some videos of FunTouch OS on youtube was almost satisfied. So ordered on very first day of pre-order. Received and boom...what a beast.
From where I should start. Here are the Pros:

- You will get almost everything what Oxygen OS offers. No ads, almost no bloatware, stock Android like experience.
- Speed is just too good...SD888, UFS3.1, LPDDR5 everything is top notch.
- In screen Fingerprint is too fast and 99% accurate. Its really really fast. Same goes for face unlock.
- Cameras are very good. No useless lenses. You get proper 3 lenses including telephoto.
- Battery backup is accurate. Getting little over a day as I dont play games and usage is average time with dual sim n data always on.
- Battery charging time is exactly 22 mins. If you are experiencing more time then check your voltage. In case of more voltage it applies some sort of protection and charging speed is reduced. If I charge it in office where voltage is proper it takes exactly 22 mins, but at home its taking 30+ mins which is not bad either.
-What left, build quality is perfect. Screen Protector is already applied.

Overall score - 9.5/10

Cons:
- One thing I miss is notifications on Ambient Display like in Oxygen OS. Can be implemented as its a software thing.
- Case Provided is bit loose from back and heavily slippery.
- Stereo Speakers are not too loud.

Rest all is well🙂

Review_title: Iqoo 7 legend initial impressions and review after 10 days
Review_text:
Battery for me took 42 minutes to get to full charge from 0. It May be due to app installations while charging. Will need to see after few charges, battery might settle down to it's original capacity. Sun legibility is not very good. Under the shade outside is manageable. Very smooth. For social aps and YouTube consumption, battery seems to be very good. Will update once I experience other aspects too.

Indoor: 10/10
Outdoor: 5/10

Display smoothness:10/10

Microphone: 8/10

Audio Speaker (loudness and clarity: 8/10

After 10 days of usage

As my main daily driver,I used iqoo for YouTube Facebook whatsapp consumption and a little bit of camera, hotspot and calls with dual sim which are on cell network of Jio and vodafone, i still got 5 hours of on screen time with 20% left consistently. Review_title: High performance value phone for the price
Review_text:
Gamers will love the phone. its a gamers phone without question. I used oneplus 5 Pro for 3+ years, i still love that phone for the size and weight. it is still an amazing phone. Oneplus phones in recent years have got expensive. I found IQ to be a great value alternate, High performance value phone for the price!!

Pros -
-build quality is top notch. metal body.
-ultra fast. boots in under 15 sec.
-camera is great. especially portrait mode which gets a 50mm equivalent lens.
-can load 40 - 50 apps without worrying about performance for days. i reboot once in a 2 weeks, that too just for the heck of it, no real reasons.
- feels great to hold.
-sound is good for the size of speakers.
-clarity of movies and photos is good. (don't compare with Sony)

Neutral
-battery life is good in normal usage. I can pull thru 24 hrs at ease. Hotspot drains the battery real quick in 8 hrs.

Cons
-Display is good for normal usage(gaming, movies etc), but if you are buying the phone to pixel peep or you are a photographer, be warned. Display has green tint. guess need to calibrate the display. no luck.
Phone charge fast and also drain battery it is happening after 6 months (battery warranty for 6 months only) . If really need better battery life don't choose this phone.

Good solid looking heavy (206 grams) brick of a phone. It is quite slippery though.
Latest top of the line SoC SD 888. As I was pressed to make a purchase, though I do not game, I decided to future proof myself.
Fast charging 0 to 100% in just around 30 minutes. It should last a day.
In screen fingerprint scanner placed low but it registers fingerprint quite fast.
Dual speaker are good and loud enough. I do miss 3.5mm jack as I have a really good audiophile earphone that I would have liked to use. Phone is Hi-Fi Certified.
I do get round it using Bluetooth, which works well. One can change the settings to 'Optimized for Audio Quality (990kbps)' under Developer options for Bluetooth.
Screen is good. Camera Quality is good.

In regards to software, I am running PD2049F_EX_A_1.76.18
As a power user, I was able to clean up the bloatware.
Use a different Launcher and can configure the UI to my liking.
The UI is fluid thanks to the beefy processor.
I don't have the green tint issue.
As a OnePlus user for last few years, I only hope iQOO/ViVo keep the upgrades coming.
I think Android 12 is in the works. But I would hope for 2 more major releases are provided in the future.
Aspirational hope is to have Origin OS which should help with the amount of criticism about FunTouch OS.

Review_title: Best in all departments!! Super loving it
Review_text:
I almost took more than 1 month to purchase this product, due to hesitance in trying new brand. But after purchase, I am super happy and loving that I made a right choice.
Pros:
- Camera quality is best in the range
- Battery life for my daily usage is very good. Mostly around 50% of battery is consumed in whole day for me and charging time is super quick. Within 25mins to 30mins full charge from 0%. on new purchase Thats really quick. Daily I keep phone for charging around 10 to 15mins since I lost only 50 to 55% battery.
- Switching between the apps is real smooth.
- Network speed and browsing web is also quick.
- Look of the phone is a beauty to watch and behold.

Cons:
- Not with respect to phone anything, but only about the back cover accessory which is provided along with the phone. It is good, but slippery. Chances of slipping from hand is more using the provided back cover. Otherwsie with respect to phone, I didn't find anything to complain.

If anyone looking to purchase new phone with the amount of features it provides and the price which it is being selled at, I think without doubt you can purchase this phone and will not regret the choice you made.
