Review_title: High performance value phone for the price
Review_text:
Gamers will love the phone. its a gamers phone without question. I used oneplus 5 Pro for 3+ years, i still love that phone for the size and weight. it is still an amazing phone. Oneplus phones in recent years have got expensive. I found IQ to be a great value alternate, High performance value phone for the price!!

Pros -
-build quality is top notch. metal body.
-ultra fast. boots in under 15 sec.
-camera is great. especially portrait mode which gets a 50mm equivalent lens.
-can load 40 - 50 apps without worrying about performance for days. i reboot once in a 2 weeks, that too just for the heck of it, no real reasons.
- feels great to hold.
-sound is good for the size of speakers.
-clarity of movies and photos is good. (don't compare with Sony)

Neutral
-battery life is good in normal usage. I can pull thru 24 hrs at ease. Hotspot drains the battery real quick in 8 hrs.

Cons
-Display is good for normal usage(gaming, movies etc), but if you are buying the phone to pixel peep or you are a photographer, be warned. Display has green tint. guess need to calibrate the display. no luck.

I have been using IQOO 7 LEGEND for almost a month and below is my use case scenarios and their evaluation while also comapring to its nearest competitors.

1) The design is a good one surely. The matte white back panel coupled with matte metal side frame give the IQOO 7 Legend a very premium look and feel. Overall the best design in its segment.

2) The part of phone that one mostly interacts is its screen or display. In this aspect the IQOO 7 legend is pretty good. The brightness is very good indoor and outdoor alike. The high refresh rate of AMOLED bring good color and contrast while giving a smoother experience. On the other hand the default color setting gives the display an annoying 🔵 blue tint but switching color to professional mode makes things way better. Also it does not show HDR in neither Netflix or Prime video. Overall OnePlus 9R and mi 11x pro have better displays than 7 legend.

3) The camera on this phone is pretty good as it has been burrowed from its cousin Vivo x60 pro. The daylight performance of the rear cameras is very good in daylight and descent in low light scenarios. Do have a look at the images I have attached. The only problem is with human subjects as the camera smoothens the skin excessive giving a doll like look even without any filters. Also in certain low light conditions the images are slightly yellowish. The rear camera is certainly among the BEST under 50k.
The front one of OnePlus 9R and Samsung S20 FE 5G is better. Overall s20 FE 5G also does the best with human subjects and portraits under 50k.

4) The video taken in 1080p in rear camera is good in well lit conditions while it does a OK job in low light. 4K videos from rear cameras are shaky and lack detail because of absence of OIS.
The front camera can max record at 1080p and is descent at best. Overall the s20 FE 5G and mi 11x pro give better videos.

4) The audio setup though stereo one suffers from low loudness. The sound is descent at best from speakers. The sound from headphones is very good. I prefer the speakers of 9R or s20 Fe 5G or even mi 11x pro over iqoo 7 legend.

5) With SD888 processor , UFS 3.1 storage and LPDDR5 RAM, the IQOO 7 legend looks like a BEAST on paper 📜. Yeah the horrible Funtouch OS just kills the experience . The phone freezes/ hangs in basic tasks like during a call or switching between apps quickly !!! Worse part is that to make the phone respond it again one needs to manually RESTART it ! Also there are many bloatwares like vivo app store and Jovi home that one cannot remove/uninstall. Also if you read the terms and conditions of the VIVO apps , there are a few points that raise eyebrows and appear suspicious. Also most data is stored in China so trade wisely. Overall, Samsung's One UI and OnePlus's One UI are miles ahead. While MIUI is worse than Funtouch OS, Oppo's Color OS is way better than both.

6) Battery life is OK, like 5-6 hrs of screen on time. The charging speed of IQOO 7 Legend is phenomenal as it charges 0-100 within 30 minutes, The FASTEST in the segment and even beats the 9R by 7-8 mins, Amazing !!!

If you have read till now, you must be interested in IQOO 7 LEGEND. I would agree with you that on paper the phone is a beast on paper while the real world usage leaves a lot to be desired especially in SOFTWARE front. The IQOO 7 LEGEND can be your dream phone on a budget albeit a few compromises. So fix your priorities first and then decide on whether to go for it.

Hope I was informative and helpfull and cheers 🥂 to your new phone. Peace✌️.

Hello guys.

Its a big review. U have to read full to get complete pros and cons .

Firstly i have been a avid used of one plus.

One plus one

One plus 3t

One plus 6t

Till here oneplus was good and never settled but then things start to change. They forgot their tagline. "NEVER SETTLE" they made us settle indeed. Giving 2 versions of each mobile model 7 , 7 pro and 7t 7t pro I was confused and waiting what to buy but one plus 6t kept on better even after 2.5 years . Now i needed more performance and memory so In search of a phone which is definitely not confusing never settle one plus shifted my focus to other phones and iqoo caught my attention.

Now the review.

Body quality is good. Not sure about scoott extension protection but i saw in some reviews its equal to gorilla 5 which is on one plus 9 pro . ( Please correct me if im wrong ) and then the display is good. 120 hz is like butter smooth . It takes time to adjust to this much snoothness. After coming from a 60hz display its a major update.

Speaker being a stereo dual could have been better . A bit louder. But in earphones its super good. As i dont use phone without earphones this may not be a problem for videos . especially youtube videos are bit lesser output. Ring and music is better than video quality.

I haven't noticed any green tint or pink tint.

Then coming to gaming loads of options to make the gameplay even better. The haptic feed back is super cool. And then the cameras are good im not a pro camera enthusiast but still does a good work better than one plus 6t . Its an upgrade for me. Selfies are also good. Low light is also fine for me .

Facial unlock and indisplay finger print scanner are very fast.

Charging speed is super fast . 27 minutes is all it takes to go from 10 -95.

Easily get a screen on time of 7 hours with my usage. (Differs with ur usage ) .

Coming to Os . Here funtouch os is a bit letdown. That too coming from oneplus oxygen OS i can feel the downgrade. Oxygen os is next to stock experience and almost zero bloat ware....here in funtouch it may be better than the other versions and might have been upgraded but tonn of bloatware which cant be uninstalled . This can be changed in next updates based on negative reviews. But its 50% to stock android .the notification bar and all are stock.

This is my personal review. And based on price i got the 12+256 at 38990 . Which is 5000 less than the original price and its a deal.

No regrets after usage of 4 days.

Except for os there is no problem and i got habituated to the os also no issues.

Thanks.

Where do I start on this... Let's start with Drawbacks..
1. Sound Quality was not that great but it's ok. None needed stereo speaker in their hands.😜
2. Battery could've been bigger but the way it provides the support is fine. Am getting atleast 8hrs of battery life with continuous screen on time. But in longer run I don't see that will happen.
3. Full brightness mode I guess none will use as 1300 nits will be too much to see in home. Why am including here is, it sometimes reduces it and enhance it. am not sure on which purpose that happens.
4. 120hz touch sampling is its own enemy when comes to touch. It misbehaves..
5. Weight is kinda annoying but I don't see other way around to handle such premium in low cost.
6. Headphone jack missing, and this is big drawback...
7. And the case they provide by default is also its own enemy.. it slips from hand like anything and makes mobile bulky as well.
8. Software looks bit old but am not geek..
9. Homescreen buttons response is not that great.. Bloat ware could've avoided as this is premium outside and garbage inside kind of feel would've Eleminated..
10. WiFi switched on although am on hotspot. That's kinda bug seems..
11. On screen thumb scanner is not that great as company or websites claimed. It's not that fast..

Now let's see the Pros.
1. Quality of the mobile. I mean physical appeal.
2. Camera is better compared to most of the rivals
3. Gaming is excellent
4. As shown in lots of videos, battery is not weak though it has only 4000 mah but has the power to sustain with heavy duty without compromising quality..
4. Many guys are talking about green tint, which I feel is the way they purposely designed it to differentiate from black background and icon bar. As far as I know it's not a bug nor issue. People wantedly highlighting it..
5. Screen On high brightness looks sexy and it can withstand few ramifications I guess.
6. S888 processor does heat up but every mobile has that. Apart from it, performance never compromised here.

Verdict: I see people claimed it has green tint issue. Battery draining faster than expected. Camera not working, flickering screen etc .. No these are all made up by people unless they received a bug handset these are false claims. It's an outright super or I would say superior performer 40K segment.. I only felt bad with sound and weight.. Battery no it's not an issue at all..

Not the perfect phone, but definitely a worthy consideration given the price. The phone looks stylish than any Android phones in market. I haveen using it for more than 3 months now and I never faced the issue of lagging. The RAM space is more than adequate. The phone initially seems like a flagship killer but after long use i understand that it's only a flagship Make-up on the phone.

The cons definitely overtake the pros. First is the UI interface which is worst with lot of unintended apps and options. It's understandable for new phone in market and we are also given options to mute or delete them. Second issue is the brightness settings of phone. The screen brightness is not recommended for low light as it hurt your eyes. Next would be the poor support the UI provides even for Google apps. I see YouTube lagging, not boz of RAM but because of the poor apps support. Every video in any third party apsa lags and only the audio plays. This is the worst experience I have had with any phone I've previously owned. Last but not the least is the batter life which is worst. I've stopped playing games as the battery would die in less than a hour. With minimal usage I'm only able to push for upto 9 to 10 hours of phone usage on single charge which is worse in current standards.

Verdict. - Great phone for secondary usage (store contacts or have a second social account or if you want a feel of Android)
Worst phone if you want to use this for your daily usage. Prefer Mi phones at this price point, they are much better.

Review_title: A true flagship killer based on the price it comes, overall a very well balanced smart phone...
Review_text:
It's an overall good package for the price point it comes, I have 12+3gb ram and 256gb varient and it works absolutely smooth its been 22 days since i have got this phone and there are no issues so far i did not even face any green tint issue with my device,
There are few of the pros and cons with this device

Pros:-
1) Excellent performance in terms of gaming the 4D vibration present in this makes alot of difference.
2)amazing 300hz of touch sampling fast responce
3)Excellent photos and videos recording easily recordable at 4k 60fps but stability reduces at 4k 60fps
4)Brightness is amazing easy to use the phone even in the broad day light
5)Finger print sensor is very fast and accurate
6)Face unlock works very quick and fast
7)Faster responce
8)Fast charging it charges from 0-100 within 25minutes
9)There are many customizable animation features like finger print animation etc...
10)pressure sensitive screen makes game much easier to play
11)Had no green tiny/pink tint issues

These are some of the pros and now coming to the cons

Cons:-
1)Battery life is not as good as expected in very high usage like gaming and all the battery would last upto 4:30-5:00 hours max but since it has a fast charger it even charges the phone in no time from 0-100 within 25 mins
In normal usage i was able to use it for one day(6-7+hours)without any problem if u game alot than you better carry your charger
2)Blot wares there are alot of pre installed apps which can be uninstalled but at this price i think blotwares must be removed
3)Speaker output is not as good as flagship phones but it an average output of the sound but in youtube it gives very less audio output
4)No 3.5mm jack
5)New updates keep slowing down the charging speed
6)Now recently I'm not able to use 4D vibration on cod mobile but it works perfectly well with other games
7)It's slightly heavy but easily manageable and will get used to it
8)ui must be more clear but funtouch os is also good
8)Phone heats up when played in extreme graphics but it does not slow down the gaming performance

These are few of the cons i have noticed so far...

This was the overall experience i have had with iqoo7 legend so far

To sum it up all to gether for this price point the specs that this phone provides is awesome and is really value for money I'm totally satisfied with this device

The battery drains comparatively fast but yet lasts for 12 hours on a continuous usage. Charge to 100% in appx 25 mins.
The phone is very good performance wise, camera is adequate, though I am not much of an enthusiast.
Feels premium in hand,
Accessories not easily available.

Review_title: Average phone, better to look for other options in this price range
Review_text: Pretty average phone, was very excited before buying it just like you are right now while reading my review. Camera is average as you can see from the pictures I've shared. Battery backup is bad but it has fast charging so I'm fine with it. It is an overkill for gaming, better to stick with some 20-25k range phone cause this is too much power that no game will use. In short: Just buy a 20-25k phone cause all of its features are identical to that range of phone except for its processor and this snapdragon 888 is too much power that no game on phone will use, it only gives you heating and lesser battery backup.

Review_title: I like the phone and smart to as
Review_text: I like the phone but imei number is not matching

If this reviews is to be divided in pros, cons and near misses

Pros:
1-SD888 : Absolute beast in terms of performance. You can throw any high graphic games at it and it will shine.
2-Funtouch OS : Very well optimised for this particular device.
3-Flash Charge : 66W Flash charge will get the battery from 0-100 in no time.
4-Future Proof : With 5G SA/NSA, the device is safe for upcoming years.
5-AMOLED Display : 120Hz AMOLED Display is bright enough for all your multimedia and gaming needs.
6-4D Haptic Feedback : No words, it should be felt ;)

Cons:
1-Battery Capacity : While I have no issues with battery life which gives an average SOT of 4-5 hours. 4400 mAh is less for a legend when competition have 5000 and above.
2-Bloatware : V-Appstore :( really, it can be annoying sometimes. While the notifications can be muted it's impossible to disable. The phone also comes with Moj and apps like that pre-installed but ofcourse they can be uninstalled.
3-Lack of Oleophobic Coating on Display : It's a fingerprint magnet.
4-Slippery Back : With or Without backcover it's slippery. You have to go for a seperate third party case.

Near Miss:
1-Camera : While it is best, it's not great. The main shooter does great job in ideal lighting scenarios but low light can be a bit tricky but in this price range I doubt if there is another choice this good.
2-No headphone jack : It's becoming a fashion to lose out on headphone jack. Could have been better if the legend had it.

Overall a best option for the 40k budget range.

Review_title: Very good hardware with mediocre software experience
Review_text:
Review after 1 month of usage:
Pros:
1. Ultra smooth 120HZ screen.
2. Great battery life with fast charging. It easily gives 5hrs of screen time even while using in 120hZ mode
3. No heating issues as with other snapdragon 888 phones. The cooling system in this phone is excellent.
4. Pretty good camera system in this price range.
5. Nice build quality with cool looking design
6. Speakers are loud enough.
7. No issues with connectivity too.
Cons:
1. Software/UI. Coming from Oxygen OS, my software experience with this phone is not at all good. I faced some weird bugs in software after 2 weeks of purchase. Most annoying among them was the battery percentage display bug. The device's battery percentage is displayed as 1% randomly in between while using the phone, even though the actual percentage is around 60-80. It stays at 1% for hours while using and then suddenly goes back to its actual percentage in between.
2. Lots of preinstalled bloatware and heavily intrusive system apps like Vivo browser etc. Third-party pre-installed apps can be uninstalled directly. But you have to use ADB to uninstall apps like the Vivo browser. Once uninstalled, the overall experience improved a lot.

Final Verdict:
IQOO 7 legend has one of the best hardware for a phone in this price range, but the overall software experience is not great. I hope IQOO improves on their UI in the coming years. Overall pretty good value for money phone.

It's best in 30k to 40k range. I'm a long time OnePlus and Samsung user so my review is based on comparison to those two company's products.

Pros.
1. Very good camera compared to mi11x and OnePlus 9r.
2. Funtouch os is very stockish and very smooth and fluid.
3. Fast charging is truly blazing fast. It charges switched off phone from zero to 100 in 23 minutes. And switched on from 10 to 100 in 25 minutes.
4. Display with 120hz is good and plenty bright outdoors. But not as good as my previous samsung galaxy display which was QHD but 60hz.
5. Haptic motor hardware of this device is fantastic.

Cons.
1. 4000mah battery is small and battery life is average. I get 5 hour SOT on average.
2. There are some annoyances in funtouch os like ads and bloatware which I have removed with adb. But some things are just weird like there's vibration feedback when opening some apps or settings but not all. Some animation differences when swiping up for home fast vs slow.
3. Vibration feedback is not that well implemented. Though vibration motor is very good and typing on keyboard provides nice tactile feel but it's implementation throughout UI is not that great. In contrast miui has implemented vibration feedback very nicely throughout UI like when increasing volume.
4. I also have green tint issue for which I'm gonna have it replaced.

Out of the box i was really disappointed with the buggy and clunky os which like a fake android almost. But i got two subsequent updates including Android 12 which have made the os experience much better and more like a oneplus phone. Lot of youtubers say that bloatware can be deleted but still there is lot of stuff that we can't delete without adb tools. Apart from these minor issues, the phones working great.. camera is great and better than the one plus 7t i was using.

Edit: after a week of use i can see that the software has a lot of minor bugs.. not upto the standards of oneplus or samsung. They should just use stock Android.

All things are good.. while playing BGMI in 90fps.. its fluctuate . battery life is not so good.. u can play bgmi 2-2.5hrs continuously with 90fps ...  Earlier it took 20 min to full charge.. now it takes 45-60 min... I dont knw why ..

8 months usage review:
Pros:
* Very good display. This phone has the darkest blacks which is very much appreciated when you watch in complete dark.
* Performance beast. So far haven't found any lag whatsoever
*Charges very fast - takes about 35-40 mins for a full charge
Amazing camera. Especially the portrait camera is too good. Although not the best camera around, the photos come out surprisingly good.

Cons:
* Very average battery life. With my usage and gaming it lasts 12-15 hours (90% to 20%)
* Camera punch hole: not the smallest punch hole compared to other phones. Also the punch hole has a silver ring around which can cause distraction sometimes.
* Placement of fingerprint reader. It is placed far too low. This is especially problematic when using single handed. You get used to it though but I wish they had put a little thought on this.
* Absence of 3.5mm jack

The screen protection is a question mark, which is not the industry top spec. Also the 120hz refresh rate is yet to impress me having come from a 60hz lcd screen.

1 month update:
* Found a minor bug in a game, related to touch point focus
* Battery lasts 1 day with heavy usage
* The notch still feels annoying

8 months update:
* The latest software update has affected the performance of auto dimming feature. Even in complete darkness it doesn't dim the screen as it used to. Couple other issues related to this.
* The cameras has a document scan option but didn't work well. My wife's 13k MI phone does a better job at this.

I Got it from the prime day sale.
12 GB / 256 GB variant.
Camera - 8/10(Many features)(Added 2 photos as sample)
Processor - 9/10 (Its fast)
Battery - 7/10 ( 4000 mAh is not sufficient )
Features - 8/10
Performance - 9/10

PROS :
1) Fast Charging. 0-100 within 15-20 mins.
2) Camera has many features like long exposure, slo-mo, timelapse, double exposure, pro mode and many smart features.
3) Ultra Game Mode with voice changer and eSports mode and many other features.(Supports bgmi too)(90 fps is still not supported)(Probably will come in future updates)
4) Faced no green tint issues, touch works great.

CONS:
1) Battery could've been more around 5000 mAh( It drains quick in heavy usage but charges also faster.)
2) Camera software needs more improvement because 48 MP doesnt give the satisfaction of 48mp.
3) No headphone jack( Had to buy one plus type C- 3.5mm from the website )
4) Back cover is slippery.

Overall the phone is great but software needs a lot of work. Its gaming centric so the performance is really good. Wifi and mobile internet speeds are great. But if you are more inclined towards the camera then consider buying a dslr or iphone 11 and above.
But still this phone takes excellent photos if you know how to use it. Telephoto lens are also great.

It is been 15 days since I've moved from OnePlus 6 (3.5 years), the transition from op6 to Iqoo7 was not that great. Few basic things like file manager app was not readily available. That made me think 🤔 about funos and iqoo. (One more incident at same day I've bought this phonetook place ,my 2 year old kid put the phone into talkback mode) I literally tried every other way but unfortunately can't disable that and took the phone to nearest vivo service center to disable that. These things doesn't bring good thoughts about this phone.
Then slowly I've started liking this phone, 120htz refresh rates,HDR, camera's,Processor mighty 888, and the rate which I got this was all a big plus( 32k) was a big plus. I'm still getting used to fun os all in all it was a good trade off.
Tried gaming few occasions during my usage experience was ok, off late I'm getting good battery backup. I'll try to update this review based on my usage as well

Review_title: Best phone if you can live with cheap display and Funtouch OS
Review_text:
After Replacement
Edit: Got the replacement. I had somewhat horrible experience with the original product.
Camera: I got mine for about 38k/-. Boy if everything works out as they were intended to, IQOO 7 Legend is undoubtedly the BEST smartphone in under 40k/- segment. I can't stress this enough. My sis uses an iPhone 12 Mini and believe me even she is annoyed at how inferior her camera performs against IQOO 7 Legend. Although that is limited to only photography. iPhone flat-out wrecks IQOO at videography though.
Performance: Almost flawless. Just damn fine. Keeps up with the BMW legacy.
OS: Funtouch OS always felt cheap, unfinished and bloated. Well it still somewhat retains the same properties. Just waiting for Origin OS, the true IQOO UI.
Display: This is the tricky part and IQOO certainly skipped steps here. The original product had horrendous green tint all over the display at low brightness.
Display(replacement): So far I think the replacement has better display with less impacting green noise. But it's definitely there.
Solution: Unfortunately many last gen AMOLED screens suffered through the same. Even Samsung, Apple or 1+. Luckily Devs can recalibrate their algorithms to filter out the issue mostly. Said Devs like Apple, 1+ and Samsung released some updates later which reduced the issue by a whole lot. Let's hope IQOO does the same.
Charging: While it's pathetic of IQOO to skimp out on that iconic 120w charger, company still managed to make 7 Legend the fastest charging smartphone of India rn. That's saying a lot.

First Impression of Legend:
Build quality : 4 Very much impressive. I have seen somany reviews but the onhand feeling is very different.even the BMW racing lines are designed very well. Power button color every thing looks good.
Display : 4.5
Body to screen display: 4
Call quality : 4
Speaker output : 3.5 Previously used ROG2 might be that is impacting me 😉
Back over quality :4
Back cover design :2.5 too much branding which is spoiling the look
Camera : 4 As this is coming with SD888 don't compare with Samsung S21 series it's double the price. At his price point we can capture good quality pics.
Customization: 4 there are so many customizations for every thing. But these should not impact the mobile in long run 🙏.
Charger : 5 this is the ultimate thing 👍. Super fast ⏩ charging.

After checking different mobiles having SD870 and 888
Finally I ended over Legend for the best deal. I have replaced my too old mobile and got 7k for exchange and 4k offer . I have paid nearly 32k. Even for 35K this is the best in the market. Don't go with branding. Even OnePlus started like this only. Let's hope for the best.
There are few unnecessary apps.

Will edit after using it for few more days.

Review_title: Words from a Oneplus 5T user, "A worthy upgrade in 2021"
Review_text:
So finally after reading reviews and watching mostly all videos about this phone I decided to go with this one. I got this phone for 42k during offer period.
Pros :
1. Phone is best in performance and refresh rate makes the display experience butter smooth.
2. Face unlock is snappy as soon as you get the phone in your hand it will unlock it so no delays in that.
3. Gaming is also smooth and I faced no lag issues or frame drops, all perfect.
4. Camera performance is just damn good bruh!!! It was unexpected for me to get this kind of quality.
5. Funtouch OS is almost a complete match to the Oxygen OS and after disabling and uninstalling the unwanted apps the User experience is great!!!
Cons:
1. Back cover provided with the phone is too slippery, so don't use it. The phone has got a good grip itself,so don't worry about it.
2. Fingerprint sensor is not that great, takes about twice impressions to recognize sometimes but face unlock compensates that so I don't have too much issue with that.
3. Green tint issue is there in my unit in lower half of the screen.
4. Facing heating issue while gaming and charging which is disappointing. But I have noticed that all 888 chip phones are facing this issue. So waiting for an update to get it corrected.
5. Battery life is average and gives almost a day backup.

All n all its a great phone in this range n with the best snapdragon chip inside. So don't think too much as no phone is perfect, you will get issue in every company's phone.

The phone itself is pretty solid with a great display (despite the green tint issue which is practically present on all AMOLED high refresh rate screens). The camera, battery (despite being 4k), speakers are all pretty great too. The charging speed is phenomenal. The main problem with this is the poor software experience. It comes installed withsl some third party bloatware and a lot of system bloatware that cannot be uninstalled or disabled. The bootloader cannot be unlocked and as such you cannot use custom ROMs which is pretty sad considering Funtouch OS is as the title says medicore at best. Basic things such as notification panel have issues with quick reply (the text is always shown in capital's), the quick reply bar itself is cropped when typing a reply, there's no global heads-up toggle, the navigation gestures doesn't have a quick switch toggle. The dark mode is greyish instead of black but with black notifications so the entire panel looks inconsistent. The camera app could be smoother. Overall it's still a pretty solid device especially for the price despite all its software flaws which would hopefully be fixed by Vivo. Imo they should still let developers access and allow users to unlock BL and flash custom ROMs that itself would make this phone the best choice for everyone in the premium segment.

Review_title: Batter life is average on this phone
Review_text:
I have 12gb Ram 256 gb rom model, I got this at ₹34,400 and getting a flagship device at this price is a great feeling. Let's divide review in pros and cons-
Pros-
1. Great AMOLED panel, brings out vivid colours.
2. Awesome network connectivity
3. Gaming beast- I played Battlegrounds Mobile India, Call of Duty, Asphalt 9, and other heavy graphic centric games and it performed exceptionally well. There was no fps drop while taking hot drop in pochinki, bootcamp.
4. Camera- It is also one of the best at this price range. You get bright images in daylight and even in artificial lighting, the doesn't disappoint. However, front camera is ok ok.
5. Overall a smooth experience when using this device casually.
Cons-
1. Average battery life, however 66w flash charge helps, it fully charges the phone within 35 minutes.
2. Lots of bloatware- I prefer you to not use apps like vivo vstore, hot apps, hot games, as they ask for lots of permission. Basically these bloatware is of no use.
Verdict- Overall a great package from IQOO, its definitely a flagship killer. If you are gamer, just go for it.
Many youtubers say that iqoo phines give good cameras but the cameras are pathetic. also many say that the phone is for gamers but...in real the phone gets too heated on playing BGMI

Sharing my Review after a weeks Use :

1.Pressure Sensitive touch works like a charm ,my Kills and Game play on BGMI has increased and we are getting more chicken dinners than before ,was missing my Iphone XS which had 3D Touch but this is awesome. Would be very Happy if BGMI provides dedicated controls for pressure sensitive Touch aka 3D touch .

2.Charging speeds are insane ,0 - 100 % 20:05 mins avg .

3.Sound has Bass that packs punch ,its powerful .

4.Camera and Night Nodes performs very well under indoor conditions and low light . no Regret there ,only thing that i am missing is customizing the watermark with special characters which is not on this device as of now .Taking Pics and recording HD content does not Heat Up the phone .

5.sunlight readability is good w.r.t the DISPLAY

6.Has Google Files for safe Data storing /making this private .

Overall I say its a good purchase and would recommend to anyone who like power packed features .
Great product from Vivo. But it used to be a gaming phone so should have some extra controls

It's a good device if you need it for heavy tasks like gaming and if you need to connect to work related resources.

Camera is Ok not great I have had better experience with poco x2 in this area.

Processor is absolutely great you won't have any issues running any applications.

RAM 8Gb+3Gb is quite enough for any kind of task you throw at it.

Display quality is Ok not that great as it should have been.

Please see every device has it's fair share of issues this has issues with green tint but its only visible at night in dark mode. Haven't encountered any major bugs yet OS is smooth no jitters or lags. Speakers are also good. Battery is a bit less it may or may not last a day depending on your usage I get 4.30 hours of SOT.

Review_title: Few hiccups But Mostly a very Good phone for Price
Review_text:
When I order this phone I was sceptical about it as I have heard bad things about software in iqoo 3.

I ordered this phone during pre booking and was willing to take risk with software.

The hardware of the phone is really amazing be it the triple camera set up( without any useless 2MP sensors), inscreen Finger print scanner, fast ram and rom, clicky and tactile buttons ..in short Hardware is amazing
But
Software is where it all start to go sideways
It runs on funtouch OS based on Android 11.
Funtouch OS is full of bloatware, unnecessary double apps like Notes, browser, playstore, games and other useless apps. It constantly give you useless notification. You can uninstall many apps but there are still many apps which are backed in OS and you cant even disable them. All you can do in turnoff notification for them and force stop them and never to open them.. Rest the OS is very close to stock Android it tons of customisation options
If IQOO can fix this and make software bloatware free I can recommend this phone to everyone without issue

BEST FOR GAMING AND CAMERA. ONLY DRAWEBACK IS THE SHORT BATTERY LIFE. NOTHING ELSE. BUT THE 66 WATTS POWER ADAPTER WORKS REALLY FAST. IT CAN FULLY CHARGE THE DEVICE FROM 0- 100% IN LESS THAN 21 MINUTES. HATS OFF TO THE IQOO TEAM. CAN'T COMPLAIN ABOUT ANYTHING ELSE

1) A big mobile. If ur fan of compact phones this will feel heavy and big. But this is a beautifully executed mobile.
2) Excellent Haptics.
3) Heating issue was not as much as expected.
4) Excellent Speakers.
5) The only drawback is the UI. It feels really underdeveloped. Color os and MIUI is lot better. They should bring about more Material You elements of Android 12

First of all that pearl white smooth finish and BMW track design is very attractive. 120hz fhd display is another level very good colour accuracy and low latency touch works awesome.
No need to say about camera simply awesome 2x zoom and potrait lens are awesome good dynamic range fair colour accuracy good image processing is simply perfect. It's 888 no need to tell performance beast. 8+3gb ram it really holds so many apps in background, at a time 2 heavy games can handle. No throttling at all, it will get little warm if you play heavy games but for 888 processer it's best heat destination. Surprisingly at charging also it's get just only little warm 35-38deg (summer) u never feel it warm at all. It's has very cool gaming mods that I don't use much . Funtouch os is ok, if origin os it's will be perfect. Battery life is very good for 4k mah full one day for mid-heavy use i got around 7hrs screen on time . The flash charging is like barry allen 0-100% just in 27min. Overall very worth for 35k.
Camera performance is average.
Gives nice performance, zero lag except for some frame drop on 90fps gaming when heated , sure with more update and optimization this issue would be fixed and performance can be improved more

Review_title: Good phones, camera lacks low light efficiency
Review_text: Camera could be more better in low light as well as focusing too.

Review_title: Good built - bit heavy, Decent OS - when configured
Review_text:
Built:

Build quality seems good.
No green tint issue.
Back glass is not equal to front glass.

OS:

Needs to be configured to remove the bloatware.
No major issues. One update received.
Responsive.

Review_title: After OS update, lot of bugs.
Review_text:
The phone was really good since it's last OS update. 3 days ago I got an update, after the update I'm facing a big issue. I can't use whatsapp voice message and in video recording cannot add voice along with video. Always show a message while whatsapp voice recording "whatsapp cannot record now as google is recording", and in camera while video recording also shows a message as "camera cannot record now as google is recording ". If restart the phone, there will be no problem for an hour, after which it will be like scratching again.

I don't know how to fix it. Really I got mad.

Everything is well and good. Meets expectations from every angle.
Little bit heavy and battery will lasts for 5 hrs on screen time. If this will not be a problem to you definitely go for it.
Review after 2 months of use :-
Did not find any issues as of now. Today the screen became un responsive once. Don't know the reason behind it. I force restarted and it's working fine. I get around 4 hrs of on screen time and if not much used I get 21 hrs of battery backup.

Update 5 sept,2021- my friend called me via whatsapp and suddenly the phone became un responsive. It shut down itself and later when I tried restarting it didn't respond for some time and later it restarted on itself. This is not a good thing I guess. I shouldn't had invested this much amount in a mobile by new brand.

I got this phone with 5000 discount coupon n icici card and @38990. Phone is not bad. But IQOO as compared to China unit has not given Gorilla glass 6 on front n back instead it has given Scot xensation glass which is not a good protection overall. Also in china the charger is 120 watt as compared to 66 watts in Indian unit. As far as OS is concerned, IQOO in India has given Funtouch OS 11.1 as compared to Origin OS in China unit. Rest all is same. But thank God for not giving Monster UI as was given in IQOO 3 which was a real crap. Over all i would like to say that this phone can be taken. Amazon now has removed 2000 rupees coupon from Legend variant which will certainly affect IQOO 7 legend Sale as per my opinion. 4 star just that IQOO has not given Gorilla Glass 6 and 120 watts charger in Indian retail unit. But as compared to IQOO 3 a big Thumbs up from my side.

Best phone with great camera
Battery is little less but...charger is capable enough to charge it in less then 22 mins from 15% to 90%....UI has alot of bloatware but can caped with third party launcher

The phone is the best value for money at present in the market.
Shifting from OnePlus7 as the last update crippled my device. Hope IQOO will not follow the same footprint.
Finger print reader is better than OnePlus.
FunTouch OS is working very well. App switching in gesture mode is not a single touch operation. Other than that I literally couldn't find any issue which would make my like miserable.
Forget about lag while using the device, super fast because of SD 888.
Camera is also superb, specially the night mode is very impressive (pic attached).
Battery is little small and require charging twice a day for heavy users like me but charging is super fast, faster than you imagine.

This phone is nearly a flagship killer. It need few improvements to be a flagship killer. I've using this for last 3 weeks and I'm happy with the performance of the phone so far. This Phone does have green tint issue.
Pros:
Great performance
Good Camera
Good connectivity
Good haptic experience
Fast charging (under 35 minutes phone get 0 to 100)
Nice build quality
Sound quality is good and clear

Cons
Green tint issue on low light and dark screen
Few bugs in UI

The issue of green tint and UI bugs can be fixed by iqoo in further updates and green tint is noticable when you knows what a green tint is otherwise you won't even notice it.

My initial reveiw

My review in short :
1) great camera
2) no green tint issue
3) amazing battery back up on moderate use

Cons :
1) screen brightness is not that great..I have iqoo3 too but amoled panel of iqoo3 is looks much brighter.
2) in screen trigger is useless on pro gaming as it needs to press bit hard and in close combat you don't have that much time.

Thank you.

Review_title: Excellent device but camera software could be improved
Review_text: Phone is very fast and charging speed is really good (full charge in 23 min) but software could be improved like camera software over sharpens the photo which makes photo unrealistic. Battery backup is good considering 4000mAh battery, will get 5.30 hr screen time if using phone continuously but when phone is in sleep mode and any background app is working battery drains quickly. Green tint issue only in lockscreen under low brightness (when lockscreen wallpaper is dark) no problem in homescreen. Fingerprint speed could be more faster although accuracy is great. Face unlock is very fast. Gaming experience is also great and stereo speakers works better than i expected, very loud and crisp speaker.

The phone is really good everything works fine as it should except the green tint issue which occurs when I'm on lockscreen most likely a software bug which can be resolved through a update the performance is top notch as promised I really wish if they would have added the 3.5 mm jack that would be really nice camera quality is really superb better than oneplus and gaming performance is also great no lags nothing no overheating battery lasted for 2 whole days on normal usage and on extreme gaming it comes down to 1 day the special game features come in handy but the game frame interpolation option is not available in the options guess they removed that overall this is a definitely a good option to invest

Review_title: Look & feel is of a flagship phone
Review_text: One thing I like about it is the fast charging, its life savior. I left my home with about 30%, forgot to top up, and had to use Google Maps for about 2 hrs in the car. It ran out of battery. Guess what, no charger with me and I had to come back. Then got the idea, and I saw the person I was with using ThinkPad with a type c charger. I used that with this phone. Can you believe it, laptop charger on this phone, it worked.

Loved the phone overall. Fingerprint reader works 7 out of 10 times which definitely needs to be improved.
Battery life seems to be dropping fairly quickly but I've been installing extensive apps so that could be the reason. But the charging speed is god level...like seriously...so that more than makes up for it.
Loved the rear camera quality performance indoors.
No green tint issue on my device that I could notice.
The cover supplied is a little slippery so I'm using another one I bought online n it seems to grip pretty well.
Whatever games I've installed run very smoothly. All heavy apps run smooth without any hiccups. Happy I went with 7 Legend instead of Oneplus 9.
Good phone with good camera, preformance, display, but battery life need to better. Overall best phone for money.

Review_title: Best phone in midrange budget with sd888.
Review_text:
Fingerprint reader and face recognition and overall phone is super fast and charging complete in below 30mins and they said in 22mins but 5,6 mins is okay it doesn't matter much.
Battery capacity should have given more.
Battery should last for around 5-6hrs.
But again charging really is fast 😉
When u play games battery does not drain fast . It's normal consumption.
Because I have used Samsung m31 which has 6000mah battery it lasted for atleast 20hrs so for me it feels like battery could have been better.
Overall I will give 4⭐ 1 less because of battery.
But i think it does not matter when u have a 66w charger.

Best flagship phone in terms of performance, camera and charging. Full charge by 20minutes. Love the screen and face id, fingerprint sensing and overall look of this legend.
Only thing is its little bit heavy and front selfie camera should have been made little more better when comparing back camera.
Gaming on this phone is superb experience. I played CODM.

While using this phone on the second day it had a hanging problem lasting for 10minutes which got corrected on charging. It just happened once.
I am really happy with this phone.
Just go for it.

Review_title: Excellent device but camera software could be improved
Review_text: Phone is very fast and charging speed is really good (full charge in 23 min) but software could be improved like camera software over sharpens the photo which makes photo unrealistic. Battery backup is good considering 4000mAh battery, will get 5.30 hr screen time if using phone continuously but when phone is in sleep mode and any background app is working battery drains quickly. Green tint issue only in lockscreen under low brightness (when lockscreen wallpaper is dark) no problem in homescreen. Fingerprint speed could be more faster although accuracy is great. Face unlock is very fast. Gaming experience is also great and stereo speakers works better than i expected, very loud and crisp speaker.

The phone is really good everything works fine as it should except the green tint issue which occurs when I'm on lockscreen most likely a software bug which can be resolved through a update the performance is top notch as promised I really wish if they would have added the 3.5 mm jack that would be really nice camera quality is really superb better than oneplus and gaming performance is also great no lags nothing no overheating battery lasted for 2 whole days on normal usage and on extreme gaming it comes down to 1 day the special game features come in handy but the game frame interpolation option is not available in the options guess they removed that overall this is a definitely a good option to invest

Review_title: Look & feel is of a flagship phone
Review_text: One thing I like about it is the fast charging, its life savior. I left my home with about 30%, forgot to top up, and had to use Google Maps for about 2 hrs in the car. It ran out of battery. Guess what, no charger with me and I had to come back. Then got the idea, and I saw the person I was with using ThinkPad with a type c charger. I used that with this phone. Can you believe it, laptop charger on this phone, it worked.

Loved the phone overall. Fingerprint reader works 7 out of 10 times which definitely needs to be improved.
Battery life seems to be dropping fairly quickly but I've been installing extensive apps so that could be the reason. But the charging speed is god level...like seriously...so that more than makes up for it.
Loved the rear camera quality performance indoors.
No green tint issue on my device that I could notice.
The cover supplied is a little slippery so I'm using another one I bought online n it seems to grip pretty well.
Whatever games I've installed run very smoothly. All heavy apps run smooth without any hiccups. Happy I went with 7 Legend instead of Oneplus 9.
Good phone with good camera, preformance, display, but battery life need to better. Overall best phone for money.

Ok I'll write a simple pros and cons review that can help people decide whether to buy this device or not.

I was using Redmi K20 before buying this mobile & I got my 2 yrs older K20 exchanged. I got this mobile in 14500/- INR after all the exchange value and bank discount. Now coming to the mobile usage experience.

What I liked in this device:
1. watching videos, it's a whole new experience for a K20 user.
2. Side mounted finger print reader ok.
3. I don't understand people complaining about slow charging, it has a 33 Watt fast charger and it does a decent job.
4. Dolby sound is a new experience for me and I liked it very much.
5. Snapdragon 870 is insanely fast & you won't notice any glitches during multimedia handling.
6. Speakers and network connectivity is very good.
7. Haptic feedback is a new thing for me and I guess it's not that bad on 11X.

What I didn't like:
1. Proximity sensor is malfunctioning.
2. Drop down window is unstable.
3. Camera quality has been compromised in this device, I was not impressed with the 4k videos taken during low light, although I'll try during daytime and let you know.
4. Battery drains a bit faster if I switch to 120hz screen.
5. It has a plastic back unlike my older k20 which makes it look less premium..
6. No notification LED
7. Double tap to lock screen not working.
8. Call recorder is useless, who tells the person on call that this call is being recorded. Complete rubbish.
8. Battery does not go beyond 99%, it is not charging upto 100%.
9. Color formation on screen are not upto the mark, you have to turn on full brightness during daylight.

All in all it has some software related issues that will be resolved in coming days.
I am a multimedia user and I don't play games on mobile. So I don't think it's a bad device given the exchange offers and its price tag. It is a flagship experience and phone won't disappoint you. My K20 worked so well in 2 yrs that I developed my trust in Xiaomi. I miss pop up selfie camera and in display finger print reader but I guess I'll get used to new features.

Thank u 👍

Pros :
Good Display,
Good battery with fast charging,
Good camera
Nice pouch for the phone.
Fast

Cons :
1. Side mount finger print. we have to press the button to unlock. I used poco F1 before. I only need to touch finger print to unlock in poco F1. I don't need to press. I am sure button will damage after a year
2. UI is not very good.
3. Only one search for apps and google. Hard to find apps.
4. 5G is not available in India( I know at the time of buying so can't complain )
5. Too much price. I bought for 24,000. old phone 3000.
6. No dedicated headphone jack. You have to use connector given in the box.
7. Face unlock don't work in dark. My old phone Poco F1 worked.

Snapdragon 870 within 28k range is a great deal on its own. But what is the use of high end processor? Gaming? For long gaming this device performs average, why? Because of it's weight; 4000+ mah battery is normal now a days; and many companies providing phns with the same specifications within 170 gm and it weighs almost 200gm which effects long gaming seasons in my opinion.

Camera sensor is great, but it needs better software optimization for image processing; 48 mp images takes too much time to load and don't even have great image quality. Normal pictures gives better results, also the ultra wide pics are great. But the macro sensor is waste of money,lack of hardware as well as software provides horrible macro shots, there is no deapth sensor, so potrait mode is software based, and the software optimization is horrible there also, but they can fix the potrait mode by optimising for natural potrait shots rather that beautified potrait shots. Camera software update is too much necessary that's why.
this phone is budget flagship phone.. camera quality is average. battery is average but if I talk about performance it's good or i say very good.

I would recommend not to go for it.

Review_title: Just the worst in every way imaginable!
Review_text:
So having spent nearly 2 weeks with this phone, here's my take on it.
Pros:
incredible screen,
Blazing fast sd 870 processor (I have the 6gb variant, and it's not lagged on me once),
Great premium look.
Cons:
The worst, and I do mean the WORST camera I have come across since I can remember! My wife's 3+ year old iphone x camera is far better! Pictures are noisy and grainy even from close distance and in good lighting!!!
I don't know what's up with the proximity sensor, but the screen randomly blacks out, especially while trying to make calls( geekyranjit spoke about it on YT) and almost every time when listening to whatsApp/telegram audio messages! And it stays blacked out for like 5-10 seconds, and tapping the screen, clicking lock button doesn't do anything! It's very annoying and very weird, I hope a software update fixes this. There's a wierd glitch where if the battery is charged below 100/99%, it drains like crazy! Barely lasts half a day even on 90% an minimal use. Drains of upto 35% overnight(standby) observed! But if it's charged full, then it lasts over 1.5 days! Thankfully no overheating issues and speakers are great too. I actually sold my s21 ultra and bought this as that phone was just a camera and nothing else. It was riddled with overheating and battery drain issues, not to mention cheap adds everywhere! It would randomly restart too. Was a nightmare that I paid 1.06 lakhs for!!! Surprisingly, this phone is a breeze to use, the miui has no adds and minimal bloatware. Also the side fingerprint reader is incredibly fast and accurate, but it's right where you would hold the phone, so expect annoying accidental touches every time! Still better than s21u "larger& improved" On screen sensor, which NEVER worked :/...So to conclude, I'm happy saving my money, but mine is a unique case. And I will not recommend anyone to buy this phone, unless they absolutely don't care about the camera and just want a great processor and screen, in which case, go for it.

1 month update: changing my review from 3 to 1 star! The battery just keeps getting worse and the battery usage doesn't know what the hell is going on. It just says mostly used by screen and phone idle, as if that's of any use :/. I'm selling this and buying a refurbished iphoneX. Android phones are torture :/

I have used Note 4, Note 6 pro and now this 11x. Through the journey i found the most robust and the most preferred was the Note 4.
As of now, the 11x seems good, updated a lot on Fast charging, bigger screen, memory, etc. But i do miss the notification light, which used to blink for any notification as well as charging.
The fingerprint reader missed sometimes.
Battery life is not amazing, nerds may need to charge twice a day.
Also i also fear of the longevity of the battery, my Note 4 was replaced without a battery change after about 2.5-3 years of use, whereas my Note 6 pro required battery change at 1.5 years

Mi 11x is a true flagship phone. I was sceptical before fonalisong this as I have read a lot of negative reviews as well.
Believe me I am really enjoying every bit of it.
Display is top notch.
I agree that it doesn't have a 3.5mm audio jack but if u pair it with one plus z2 bass headphone it just blows ur mind.

Overall very happy with this phone.

Review_title: Mi11x is the perfect flagship  and is an absolute beauty with lots of brains .
Review_text:
1. Super Exceptional display:
• Unparalled display , unseen in the industry at this price band ??? ; my friends having One Plus are now regretting
• after having a look at the display one question that came to my find - is it really a 30K phone or am I missing anything?
• Colors on display are of the next level- very vivid and bright yet natural
• Latest E4 Amoled is magical – vivid colors, 1300 nits brightness, beyond comparison. Thanks Xiaomi for bringing a display found in competition phones upward of 1 lakh Rs
• Perfect for gaming. Highest touch sampling rate of 360 Hz doing its magic
• That punch hole is literally invisible. Haven’t seen a smaller punch-hole on any phone

2. Snapdragon 870 - one of the strongest and latest
• Have been using this phone for gaming and this just kills anything that’s brough it. Extremely good performance
• Absolutely no heating at all despite gaming and hours of video watching
• Snapdragon processor plus DisplayMate A+ display plus 360 Hz touch sampling rate just makes this the best phone for gaming

3. Camera
• Beautiful camera setup – Xiaomi just never ceases to amaze with their camera
• This is a refreshing breather from usual saturated pictures. Xiaomi has just nailed the camera tuning on the device to get the perfect shots on the device
• Xiaomi in unparalalled when it comes camera features – in love with what all this device can do.
o Time freeze motion mode
o clone mode
o The level of detailing on AI Skyscaping pitch perfect
• Best camera phone I’ve used so far

4. Design
o The best implementation of glossy black in my opinion. It’s just beautiful and looks super premium
• Xiaomi never ceases to surprise with its colors
• Feel great in the hand
• Finally a flagship that’s thin and light. it is a perfect device feel

- Pleasantly surprised with how slim the device feels despite packing such a big batter. Not sure what tech Xiaomi has used, but double thumbs up for this
• This phone just feel right to hold! Kudos to their design team

5. MiUI
• Finally Xiaomi has heard its consumers. MiUI on this device is an absolute pleasure to use
• it would not be an exaggeration to say that it is the cleanest UI in the industry now
• Absolutely No Bloatwares and a very clean experience
• Wow! Xiaomi has finally combined best hardware with amazing software. Cleanest, and slick MiUI ever! Thanks Xiaomi
• I saw videos of how MiUI is more optimized and clean on Mi 11X. While I was apprehensive, but now I understand what they meant. This is a great effort on Xiaomi’s part.

6. Other features
• I thought Audio zoom was a gimmick, but that actually works. looks like a sci fi experience Great job Xiaomi!
• Audio zoom with camera zoom is a master stroke.
• Xiaomi understands Indian fans better than anyone and this comes with IP 53 rating , protects your flagship with simple splashes etc.
• The beauty of this phone is guarded by Gorilla glass 5 on front and back No compromise on quality

Battery 🔋 Life is awesome 🙂.but display can't imagine would have black crash issue and colour are not paled.
But usually display with my companion ☺️ feel happy.i am tooo much media consumer. I have another Xiaomi 11 i that display is much better than mi 11 i e4 samsung amoled display..

Specifically bought this device after looking at the developer community , lots of custom ROM's being actively developed for this device !
Phone is snappy thanks to SD870 with UFS 3.1 & LPDDR5 Ram (easily future proof for a minimum of 3 years).
Best screen in this segment (it doesn't support 90hz tho , only 60/120hz) super smooth crisp colours.
Way better than Iqoo and Realme counter parts as they have almost no developer community.
Had to use it for one week with Miui 13 as bootload unlock time is one week , miui 13 is decent plenty of features , smooth animations and decent battery life , it gets shipped with some bloatwares that can be removed , plus no ads on the UI (be sure to uncheck while setting up on first boot).
Currently using with CrDroid 8.4 and it's heavenly , plus you have the freedom to use custom mods like disable FlagSecure to take as in restricted apps hooking apps to unlock features , limiting battery charge to 80% to increase longevity of battery and lot more via root (Magisk) & Xposed (Lsposed) framework.
The real potential of 870 chip is unlocked on custom ROM's.
At dynamic 120 hz battery can easily last a day you can even extend it more using 60hz.
The camera is decent performer too and with gcam it's even better !
Got this device with 5000 exchange bonus on a 4 year old device , so it was a pretty sweet deal for me.
Didn't go with 888 or 8Gen1 devices as they are being manufactured with Samsung Node and not TMSC which is inefficient and is causing major heating issues , 870 has no such issues.
This will easily last 3 year (at minimum) even if you buy it in 2022.

Review_title: Nothing beats this for the price
Review_text:
I've had this phone for a month now and man it's been awesome.
Everything is great about this phone, I've seen many YouTubers complaining about the Cameras but it depends, like come on. If you give any person from a general population a DSLR, most won't even know how to use it and there are some who'll take DSLR like shots from phones itself, it basically come down to the skills more rather than the camera hardware, besides, you've got all these photo editing apps to make the image look according to your preference so I'd say cameras are good enough, you can install GCam too if you really want that post processing. Video features are amazing the battery easily gives me about 6-7 hours SoT on average to heavy usage. Gaming is great and I literally have no complaints about this phone except for one. If you like using the phone without the case, don't go with the black color option, it's literally a mirror and gets too much smudges. I'd recommend you the white one, it's clean and sexy af, anyway. The phone's great, even in 2022, I think this has to be the best for the money. Don't forget this is the Legendary Poco F3 everyone loved outside of India, it's just the naming that didn't give it enough recognition here.
Good product..

Great phone with killer performance due to powerful Snapdragon 870 chip. Multitasking, photos + videos and gaming all quite good due to the strong cpu, gpu and image processor of 870.

Coming to build quality, it is quite comfortable to hold due to curved design and yet sturdyand weighs less than 200 grams.

Coming to MIUI, it takes time getting used to... Coming from One Plus but it has a lot more options and there are no ads / bloatware that people complain about.

Scrolling and watching movies is quite good becauss of the smooth 120 hz amoled panel.

Camera while being a 48MP sensor is much better than my previous One Plus 7 camera in terms of color accuracy and details. Possibly due to the better processor 870 vs 855

Coming to Cons - it is not built for small hands and will require 2 hand operation. It does get hot during summers but that's common to all phones with high end processors.

Updating this review because got the much awaited MIUI 12.5. A few thoughts on it.

1. It feels a lot faster. Gestures especially seem to be very optimized on 12.5 and haptics are much better.
2. Battery life seems have to improved by 40-50 mins
3. Allows for removing almost all the apps. Making it cleaner experience if one wants it.
4. Visuually the icons look much cleaner to the eye.
5. Notifications are now getting grouped together making it easier to use.
6. Quick access menu looks much cleaner and one can access their smart devices from the mi home app in this menu itself.

I saw some negative review, so i am little worried before i buy, but i under stand that is not true.
High quality display, fast charging... High quality photos... All over excellent phone... Go for it, never disappoint..

I ordered this phone on 26th. May 2021 PM and received it by 29th. May 2021 AM. Kuddos for timely delivery to Amazon especially considering the pandemic we are into.

Now the best part, I got this device at INR 24500. How ? I applied a coupon discount (I don't remember from where did I get that coupon) of INR 1999 + HDFC Credit Card Offer of INR 3500. This was a Steal Deal for me.

Now let's come to the 'actual' review.

Design - 9.5/10 - The Cosmic Black colour is classy and sassy. Deducted 0.5 mark because the back side is a fingerprint magnet and there's a slight camera bump although both the issues can be solved easily by putting on a good back cover.

Screen - 9/10 - 120 Hz Refresh Rate + 360 Hz Touch sampling rate + HDR 10+ Display with 1300 Nits of peak brightness is an absolute blessing. Deducted 1 mark because the screen resolution is full HD Plus and not Quad HD.

Performance - 10/10 - Snapdragon 870 with Adreno 650 in a sub 30k phone. This deserves a 10/10.

Durability - 8.5/10 - Gorilla Glass 5 on front and back is definitely a plus. What breaks my heart is that it's IP 53 certified and not an IP 68 certified Device although IP 53 is justified for its price tag but I'm a bit greedy 😛

Battery - 9/10 - 4520 mAh with 33 Watt fast charging. In actual test it charged from 1% to 100% in 56 minutes which is at par with the claim. Deducted 1 mark because it gets slightly heated during charging and gaming. I understand that it happens with all the device but it's little more compared to my OnePlus 8 Pro. Honourable mention to the ultra battery saver mode, I don't what crazy stuff is that but in emergency that shit will last you a whole day with just 15% battery.

Camera - 8/10 - At par with most of the competition in its range. I particularly liked it's Dual mode where you can use both front and back camera at once and also it's colour accuracy is good but you may sometimes find blown out highlights when the background is shiny even with HDR on. Also video Stabilization is very average.

Sound - 9/10 - Clear sound and loud enough.

Final verdict - It's one the best bet in it's price segment and if you can have it below 28K then go for it blindly. Even otherwise it's a great deal 🔥🔥
Overall a great everyday phone. Performance is amazing

Review_title: The best value for money product !
Review_text: Experience a flagship performance and a premium build and user interface.

The phone is great. i got delivered a product which was manufactured April 2021. box was a bit dirty and probably it was unsealed & resealed again by the seller (has double VOID text under the seal sticker).

Anyway back to the handset.
the build quality is great except for the volume & power button they move little side by side not tigh as we see on other mobiles.
Display is great. no green tint. if you're seeing green tint try changing settings, turn off AI HDR and Smoothen Brightness Transition, Reading Mode Options. It should help.
Performance is good for casual gaming. i see a bit heating on CODM maxed settings. in normal settings not much heating.
battery seem to be draining faster than normal let's see how it goes after the battery reaches max capacity after few charge and discharge cycle.

Update: Get the Device Replaced because of poor battery backup. The new one is giving better backup then last one after 1 charge cycle. Will Update after 2 more Charge - Discharge Cycle.

What i like :-
Competitive performance
Vibrant and fast display
Loud stereo speakers

What i don't like:-
Underwhelming cameras
Quirky, buggy software with no update commitment
Average battery life under heavy use

Review_title: Decent phone but no market value for reselling.
Review_text:
Pros-

Looks great.
Premium feel.
Fast charging.
The screen is remarkable, honestly one of the best I have ever seen especially in this price range.

Cons -

The software is too glitchy. Often times I couldn't get it to do what I wanted it to do. And there are too many gimmicky things that you lose count of what does what. It was my first experience with MIUI so maybe that's why.

The biggest con has to be the resale value. It had an MRP value of 34999 iirc, and I got it for 22000 after exchange. I tried to resell it after a couple of days and the best offer I could get for it was 19000. And even Amazon was selling it for 22000 without exchange. Felt ripped off to be honest.
Ok

This is my first Xiaomi device and I have to say I'm truly impressed. The phone looked stunning right from unboxing, the design looked fresh and gave a flagship experience. Finally, I have a phone that feels comfortable in my hand and doesn't feel like I'm holding a heavy brick. Must say the real MVP is the display on the phone, this has to be the best display that you can find in this price segment, I have tried a lot of so-called flagships and their screens looked so dull as compared to the Mi 11x. I watch a lot of TV shows and anime on my phone and this has completely changed my experience, hats off to Xiaomi for pulling this one. First impression of using MIUI has been amazing till now, it's crisp, filled with so many functionalities and customizable in almost every aspect.
Next would be the camera, I had seen a lot of youtube reviews before buying it and have to say that the device is bang-on, just loving the macro photos. One unique feature is the audio zoom, that combined with video zoom takes videos to the next level.

This phone is really a good value for money phone. It feels good in hand, offers one of the best display, descent charging speed & battery, good camera and fantastic performance. For regular usage it does not overheat and handles all apps well. Now MIUI 13 update has also arrived and hopefully will be getting another year of software update too.

Review_title: Mi 11 X A super premium phone at a budget price
Review_text:
Firstly, I must admit that I was blown away by the display on this phone. It's super bright and super smooth. I haven't seen a better display on any phone yet. 120 Hz refresh rate with 360 Hz touch sampling rate is a dream come true for any gamer like me.

Secondly, the Snapdragon 870 processor make the phone usage experience extremely smooth and delightful.

Coming to camera, the phone doesn't disappoint at all. With so many cool shooting modes like clone mode and the time freeze mode with AI skyscaping, I can now proudly flaunt my photography skills with ease.

The phone fits perfectly in your hand and is super light and slim even after having so many flagship hardware and specs. The frosted glass back make the phone look extremely gorgeous.

The MIUI on this phone is the claenest I have seen. No bloatware on the UI accentuates the experience even more.

Camera zoom coupled with audio Zoom seemed to be a little too much to ask for but when I really tried this on my phone, I was pleasantly surprised and this cool feature could prove to be of fantastic use in adverse shooting conditions.

Overall a 10 on 10 to the phone and Xiaomi has really proved that when it comes to technology, they are the best in the industry.

Review_title: Under 30k the phone with best performance, display, speakers with decent (avg) camera
Review_text:
I replaced previous Mi11x becoz of green tint issue and faced this even at 50% of brightness so replaced it and got new one .this one also has this Issue but only in lower brightness.. Even this issue green tint issue is common nowadays in 120hz displays...even OnePlus 8 pro,nord, samsung s20 etc had this issue .So Xiaomi should look at their quality control..

I was using Honor 8 pro but last year it stopped working and dead then I started using old redmi note 3 which was there at my home and bought it in 2016.When i was using Honor 8 pro,i used to hate miui becoz of bugs, interface,ui and icons etc but when i used redmi note 3,i became used to miui then after that i was looking at phone with flagship processor, performance,display speakers etc from dec 2020..saw OnePlus nord in store but didn't liked it..So in april Mi11x launched..i was thinking and expecting it to launch at 25k for base variant 6gb ram but it launched at 30k..it was out of budget so i waitee for 2 months for offers and finally bought it at 26k..and i would say its a best device under 27k in terms of display speakers, performance, design etc so lets talk about seperate points in detail

1. PERFORMANCE: Its the best phone under 30k in terms of performance,I switched from Huawei kirin 960(Honor 8 pro) to Snapdragon 650(redmi note 3) to Snapdragon 870(Mi11x)
So it was a huge upgrade for me..Phone is super responsive and quick..It has latest ufs 3.1,lpddr5 ram which makes this phone as a performance flagship..Games run at 60 fps with no lags,fame drops..Even Snapdragon 870 was one of the reason to buy this phone.As we know Snapdragon processors are more optimised,has no heating issues,more support to custom roms,more optimised for games,long lasting compared to mediatek processors

DISPLAY: Its the best under 30k,Superamoled 120hz..even better than samsung A51's display,also it is rated A+ by display mate..Its very bright at outdoors 1300 nits..So no doubt about display

Design And In hand Feel: Its very good and feels very premium in hands due to glass back but it should have had come with matt black color..becoz cosmic black color is very fingerprint magnet..but if u use back cover then no problem..also instead of plastic frame,then should have had given metal frame
But under 30k most of oems are giving plastic frame..

CAMERA: Its decent,I compared Mi11x's camera with Samsung A51 and found no difference,even in details.. Even Samsung's sensor captures more light and photos looks brighter and post processing of samsung literally change the photo..So Mi11x has decent/avg camera..they should have had given Sony imx 586 instead of 582..So in updates Xiaomi definitely needs to improve camera, post processing by software updates..Macro camera is very good.. selfie camera is also good
In video recording, Xiaomi has given eis even at 4k 30 fps.. videos are very stable from this device
Iqoo 7 has better camera than Mi11x

HAPTIC FEEDBACK: Xiaomi used X axis linear motor for haptic feedback and Its top notch,flagship level..We can feel different types of vibration in different tasks..not like normal vibration motor Also I had haptic feedback issue on my new Mi11x after replacing... previous one didn't have that issue Haptic didn't worked with back gestures etc so after uninstalling system launcher updates it started working again..many of users also faced this issue..

SOFTWARE: Since i was hater of miui,but after using miui 12.5,my thoughts literally changed..Miui 12.5 is very optimised,no ads,no such bloatware,feels smooth and has tons of features which u never think about BUT Xiaomi india do partiality in terms of updates, features..In Chinese Miui 12.5 u can install many of system apps which cant be uninstalled in Indian/Global Miui 12.5 and Chinese miui has more features compared to Indian/Global Miui
So Xiaomi definitely needs to treat Indian miui users same as Chinese ones and should provide give same features to both So Software is the only thing where Xiaomi is lacking right now so they should improve miui like samsung one ui or OnePlus oxygen os

BATTERY LIFE : Its good and lasts full day..If u r a normal user then u will get 7-8 hrs of Sot easily in 120hz and if u r a heavy user who play games then u will get 5 and half hrs to 6 hrs of sot in 120hz..In 60hz u will get even more sot
FINGERPRINT SCANNER: Before buying this phone i used to hate side mounted fingerprint scanners but after using this device,i can say side mounted are way more accurate,faster than in display ones..But if Xiaomi is selling this phone at 30k then they should have added in display fingerprint scanner

CHARGING: Xiaomi provided 33 watt charger in box which is sufficient and phone takes around 45-55 min to full charge which is enough..but competition is providing 65,66 watt charging but it degrades battery health..33 watt charger is sweet spot

Speakers: Xiaomi ahs given proper speaker instead of giving it in earpiece.. Speakers are very loud and crisp..we can say its a proper dual stereo speakers with hi res certified and also has dolby atoms
5G: Mi11x has only 2 5G bands..even global version of Mi11x which is poco f3 has multiple 5G bands but in india they only gave 2..Even OnePlus nord,9,9 pro,9r has 1 or 2 5G bands,Iqoo 7 u also has 1 so dont know why companies are not giving multiple 5G bands in india only..Also not sure whether 5G bands can be unlocked by software updates or not in future
This phone also has memc technology which can convert 30fps video to 60 fps
Also if u use custom roms in your phone,then this phone is for you..becoz Xiaomi phones has best custom roms support which is not the case with iqoo,realme etc..Even after Xiaomi stops giving updates then u can install various custom roms
So If your priority is performance,display,speakers, premium feel etc then u should look at this phone and if u r a a person who consume more content or who take photos casually can also buy this phone..
So decision is yours
So I can sum up with
Camera: 6/10
Performance: 10/10
Display: 10/10
Battery: 8/10
Software: 7/10
Speakers: 9/10
Overall: 8/10
Surprisingly day time pics have inferior finish. Display of high quality
